In same section) but the motion recording did not happen because 1st option enable was turned off. Can you allow us to have cam record motion without setting up notification on at cam level. I have multiple cam and want all to do motion recording but only few to to send notification.

title: Love it so far
text: I don’t get all the negative reviews. First of all, we’re supposed to be rating the app, not the whole system. Regardless, both the app and the system were easy to install and set up. Took maybe 15 minutes to get everything running (not counting mounting). Camera quality is great, even night mode is impressive. There can be a slight delay but the system is only as fast as your network and phone or tablet. Overall, amazing for the price.

title: Blink security system
text: Very pleased with this system. I have 8 cameras set up around my second home which is over 70 miles from my main residence! System does exactly what it is to do! Receive notifications when ever the cameras go off… a short delay in receiving the notification but is doable! I had an Arlo system and was never able to get a satisfactory response to the system when needed help. The cameras are sitting in my closet! I will toss the complete system!

title: How about adding the same storage options you have on your cloud to USB?
text:
There’s a lot to like about this, but one of the most annoying issues happens when you’ve bought the sync module and the USB stick for video storage instead of paying the cloud storage fees every month. The USB stick will fill up with videos that do not auto-delete, and there is no way in the blink app to delete all of your videos at once. You must go through one by one and delete individual videos, or remove the USB stick to format it on a computer. Please add some file management features to the sync module. Thanks.

Update Aug 2021: still no auto delete. Down to one star since it’s basically unusable.

title: Not working.
text: I started getting these cameras 2.5 years ago. They worked well in the beginning so I would add more indoors and out. 2 of my outdoor cameras (1 new version and one old version) are now not working. The screen is grey. They worked all day today up until the last 15 minutes. Very frustrating. Also, I get alerts on my iPad and iPhone saying there is movement in the front yard. But there is NO video. I exit the app and re-enter but sometimes it takes several minutes to see the video. This has been happening for at least a week. If this continues we may have to switch to a hardwired system.

title: Great design- the future of video cameras
text:
I have a $10,000 wired surveillance system with 16 cameras and I have stopped using it because the blink cameras are so much better in every possible way . Easier to install by days, easier to keep access on my iPhone working, better images and no mess of wires in my home any longer.

Blink has the design that really works. People writing negative reviews are simply incompetents who likely know nothing about networks or phone apps etc. this is a fantastic system from every angle .

title: Unbelievable for a wireless camera system
text: I worked for years in security systems. The kind of money you would have spent to get a hard wired system that did anything even close to this... crazy. We’ve had our 5 camera for a year now. The battery life has been excellent. Haven’t replaced any yet. Lately the notifications have been delayed and sometimes we will get duplicate notifications for an event even after we’ve viewed the footage. Looking forward to the next gen camera.

title: Good camera limited range from the hub
text: My only real issue is the hub had to be very close to the router for it to work, and the cameras have to be fairly close to the hub. I got 3 cameras and I had to do a lot of testing to see where I could place the hub and the cameras to get them to all be within working range of the router and each other. One of them I have no use for now as where I need to put it is too far out of range of the hub. It’s no more than 30 feet away but if I put it there I can’t get the camera and hub to work. Move about 10 feet closer and it works fine

title: New cameras
text: They didn’t charge but with the ‘new’ blink they do and feel it should have been in the description when if first changed. I was referring a lot of people and purchased 4 more end of last year not knowing this and rather than stating this at first install, it came up after at least 5 months of services, not 30 days as it began appearing. If you make a mistake, own it and grandfather people in or just own it and apologize, offer a return or something and then people will want to stay without a bitter taste on how this was handled. Bad management.

title: Nothing but problems
text: Got these cameras from QVC two weeks ago, already had to call blank three or four times. Their app states that help is available 24 seven, totally untrue! The one camera kept going off left and right and the lady I talk to on the phone told me to turn the sensitivity down to number five, that night it went up to 651 recordings in four hours. I turned the sensitivity down to four and last night I had 755. The battery is supposed to last two years it didn’t even last two weeks. I do have to admit during the day the picture is unbelievable and crystal clear.

title: Great option for affordable wireless camera
text: I don’t have many outlets outside and didn’t want to hardwire a camera. I also wanted ones that can be moved around outside if needed. So far Blink has fit the bill perfectly, works great with my Alexa and iOS app and is super easy to use. The free cloud storage is great and now that I can schedule arm / disarm it’s filling every need I had for outdoor monitoring. I’m not big on having cameras inside my home but if I did want to do that it would be great for that too. Highly recommend!

title: Live View Failed
text:
If we arm the cameras and it’s detecting movement (recording) we can’t access the live feed. That’s fine, until the last update or two. Beforehand it was a 3-second period between a detection and when the live feed would work again. Now, its 10-12. It frustrates us that it takes longer to check the live feed which reduces our chances of catching something in the act as soon as it’s detected.

A solution could be to create a secondary system in the programming so that it can record AND stream live simultaneously.

title: Ring is better than blink don’t waist your stars
text: Ring has way more features better video feedback can see live right on point no lags blink lags behind about 5 to 8 seconds and glitches audio is really fuzzy pitchy sounding on it ring has better audio can here clear as day so time lapse on ring even though u pay 100$ for one camera it’s better than paying 180 for 2 of the blink cameras btw one of them doesn’t work for me so vasectomy waist of money going through blink the app is so awful compared to ring app. But since my money went to waist I’ll still try to use the blinks hopefully they have some better stuff coming out in updates soon or in features

title: Great affordable system
text: I have had the Blink system for a year now and I really like it.  I live in and older home and running wire for a wired camera system was not a very appealing idea.  I was skeptical about a wireless system but decided to give Blink a chance. Got a nice deal during Prime days and glad I took the chance.  Two improvements I would like to see is 1080p and better motion detection.  It takes camera to long to start recording once motion is detected.

title: Great Camera System
text:
I paid AT &T for their camera system. The features are great. However, I have hackers in my neighborhood that can get easy access into the system. I was never notified by AT & T that anyone had invaded my system. Consistent break-ins into my home for years. I had to move out. 
With Blink, hackers invaded my app, Blink was able to notify me right away through email to  let me know I had been invaded. This is a very important feature for me.

title: wonderful until recently
text: I was a Kickstarter supporter of Blink, have a number of units, etc. Have been very happy with the system until today. What use is a security system that won’t work when you need it? Tonight an alarm went off and it was the first time in all these years I wanted to use it for security, so I went to open my Blink app. It refused to work until I “updated" my software although I was using the same os for the app that I had always used (dedicated iPad for home security stuff) and had changed nothing since last time I used it. Thus, the software should still work. Worse, it would not update. So much for security. At least the Ring doorbell showed why the alarm went off. bummer

title: Horribly buggy, sync broken, motion detectors awful
text: It’s amazing how a great concept can be implemented so badly across the board. I bought a system with 3 cameras. One camera broke within a week (repeated turning on and off til battery dies). The other two either detect nothing or if they do turn on the videos never show up in the cloud. It worked for a time but now no more. I’ve reset the modules and reconnected to WiFi (the problem is not user error). I think that most of the issues are in the app, software or firmware. I would not recommend these to anyone. They are bad at every aspect of what they are supposed to do. In the end you get a very very expensive sign in your yard as a deterrent. Oh and the sign is actually sold separately!!

title: Great cameras, creepy phone audio takeover
text: At random, when the camera is triggered, instead of recording and saving the video in the background, it will start recording a live video and play the audio on my phone, overriding anything I have open. It doesn’t open the blink app, so all of the sudden my phone will be playing live-streamed audio that I can’t turn off with no indicator as to where it’s coming from. It scared the crap out of me the first few times it happened until I figured out it was the blink app. I couldn’t find a bug reporting link so I’m hoping this review will find a developer. Please fix this ASAP.

title: Please update app. Way to slow and hard to use
text: This camera system is great because it’s all wireless but even with high speed WIFI it still is very slow in loading or even taking live videos everything takes 10 mins to load and is very delayed and about 80% or the time when I try to check the live feed camera it takes forever to load, then doesn’t do anything and says “Camera busy” or “unable to load live” so you really have to play around with this thing to get it to work. I definitely don’t trust this thing with my home security, I need a camera that works all the time and is 100% reliable and not 50/50..

title: Setting

title: Great security cameras with 2 big shortfalls
text:
I’ve had these cameras for a couple of years now and they do have great video and audio quality. However two main issues as some reviewers have pointed out.
1. Notifications are spotty and do not always appear instantly and sometimes require you to open the app to realize you had a motion detection
2. Geofencing for one and multiple users (home occupants) would really complete these cameras. That is, last to leave the home arms, and first to arrive home disarms.

Otherwise great simple wireless cameras.

title: Still dealing with app issues!!
text: The ability to delete more than one clip at a time is an still issue. When I have a slew of clips to sort through it is a pain to not be able to delete more than one clip at a time. What gives?? It would be simpler to delete more than one clip!! What are you guys going to do about this?? At this point after having made multiple complaints I can for sure say that the devs don’t listen to their users. It’s a simple fix! And after having had to deal with these issues I feel that I will ditch Blink  for tm another system. I don’t care that I have invested several hundred dollars in this substandard gear!! Ughh!!

title: Awesome product
text: I have these cameras in my home and business and they are awesome! The camera interface is so nice and each camera has a ton of settings and features you can enable or not. If your someone who says the battery does not last two years you are recording way to long, you have them on 24 seven and your sensitivity is set way to high. There are no monthly fees. I have 10 cameras total and not one problem!

title: App randomly starts running in background
text: Haven’t had too many technical issues with these since purchasing in March. However, I guess since the last update, my boyfriend and I now have an issue where the app starts running in the background on our phones for no reason. We can have our phones in our pockets or be browsing the internet and suddenly start to hear the sounds coming from one of our cameras. title: Horrible app
text: The cameras are nice and show a pretty good picture for the price but the app is horrible, easily takes 1-2 minutes for the live view to load and that’s if it doesn’t crash expect you see “system busy” or “unable to load” frequently (I have 100 mpbs of wifi with only 3 devices hooked up to it so WiFi speed isn’t the problem) while that doesn’t seem like a long time when you’re trying to see who is in front of your house quickly speed matters. The app is constantly crashing, the app makes these cameras unbearable. Switch to another brand and save the headache.

title: BlinkXT
text:
I watched my sister-in-law struggle with her Ring Video Pro. The thing would never stay connected to WiFi, even with a new power transformer and a Ring wifi extender. 

Instead I bought the BlinkXT (weather proof) camera. The camera is very easy to set up and connecting the sync module was just as easy. The audio and video quality are excellent and the Blink app is simple to set up and just as easy to use. I’ve since added another BlinkXT to the back of my house.

title: Useless

title: Needs some improvement
text: The cameras are easy to navigate and use. The visual quality is great as well. It would be nice if when movement is sensed the video popped up on your camera. title: 3 years in. No changes

title: Needs images on notifications
text: When I’m at work and a notification comes in there isn’t a thumbnail of the video. All I get is a blink on X camera. Very inconvenient while at work. My Wyze camera shows an image on my Apple Watch without ever having to open my phone. It allows me to determine if the alert was simply a car, the cat, or something serious. If Blink added the ability to see an image with alerts the app would easily be 5/5. Please add this feature.

title: Useless
text:
I can’t express how useless this app is. Nothing ever loads in real-time. Ever. The programmable active and dead-zones are never consistently working. Forget trying to catch anything live. Forget trying to see what’s happening at your house if a clip just won’t load. It will probably take days to actually get it to work. Forget it if you have an average or larger size house. The one dongle will require WiFi extenders to make the range,
And that subsequently causes ‘cameras’ (dongle) to wander between connections and subsequently render the app useless even more of the time. I’ve never been able to just get an alert, go in, and actually just see what’s happening.

title: Great system, annoying login after each update
text:
Really like the app other than after each update we have to reauthenticate our iOS devices to gain access. Ironically, even though we can’t log into the app without reauthenticating after an update, we continue to get notifications that the cameras have detected motion. 
App is easy to navigate. I like that I can download video captures, and can jump on my camera at any time it is not recording to see what is going on.

title: Easy and quick
text:
I’m 80 yrs. and installed BLINK with 4 cameras at my home then later showed my neighbor how simple it was to do for her house. 
Aside from feeling safer and it being easy to install and use, it also is fun to use and check on different rooms. I have one camera in an out building across my driveway where my 4 cats have shelter from weather. Quite amusing. Shoes the cameras are quite sturdy as cat attracted by blue light knocked off shelf once. Just picked it up and put over on wall that can’t be reached. Works great.

title: Good, but
text:
You can’t record a clip on demand or take a picture... the only way to save footage is for the sensor to pick up motion and start recording. So if you are watching live, good luck saving evidence... or getting a picture... you have to arm it and hope the action is still there moving around... That is the only way to save footage. Kinda weird that it can only record when it wants to and won’t let you start it. 

You have to take screen shots if you want live footage when you want it...

Add functionality and Apple Watch App!! Please.

title: Wow, all that work and the most basic feature is missing
text:
A total redo of the app and the most obvious usability feature is still missing ...  This app needs to have a "mark all as seen" feature to get rid of the annoying red circle that show 100's of unwatched clips.  I don't know about you but I don't spend my days wading through clips of the mailman, lawn guys, godzilla-like wasps and random bicycles that trip my motion sensors.  I can see most things from a thumbnail without opening the clip.  Yet everyday we see that red circle with a number that means nothing because we can't clear it without deleting clips.

Aaahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh

Basic stuff that every app had, how does this get past QA and human factor testing?

Product manager: Please stop adding stuff till you do a usability assessment and use the app in real life for a bit ...

Sorry for the rant but this is way past silly

title: The Worst: Update of Review
text:
This new update has made my cameras useless. Go back to the old version. At least it actually worked then. Now I have 8 useless cameras.

Update: A new update came out yesterday fixing all issues that my cameras were having. I'm glad that Blink fixed the issues they created but I hope they will test updates better in the future so as not to make cameras useless after updates.

title: Versatility
text:
After a year of using the Blink cameras I can honestly say that they are amazingly versatile. 

I started with all cameras being used for Security, but later repositioned one of the cameras to monitor a wildlife path through my yard. The amount of activity recorded at night is amazing. 

The motion detection and infrared can be adjusted up or down to meet the needs of the specific location. 

The temperature sensor is still in beta test, and cannot be a reliable means of monitoring. My camera has reported as low as 15° and as high as 146°, and I’m near the pacific coast. 

I have shared my experience with several friends, who have purchased their own Blink cameras. 

If I could make one improvement it would be to allow specific zones of the image to be monitored for motion and not what appears to be slightly more than the viewable frame.

title: This app is way too glitchy!!!
text: My cameras seem to work just fine, but this app is crazy!! Every time I try to log onto the cameras it’s worse than a crap shoot! Rarely does it open the cameras on the first try, I often have to close and reopen and even delete and redownload the app and still get the same issues… with messages reading “system is busy” or then it will go to “cameras offline” when it’s not! One of the cameras constantly reads that it’s “offline” no matter how many times I hit the button to reset them smh…This is so frustrating that I can never use my cameras especially when I need them the most!

title: Horrible
text: If you feel like you would like to see what’s happening on your property (which is probably why you would want cameras), DO NOT BUY THESE. You will capture maybe 25% of activity on a good day, maybe 0% on other days. I can go dance right in front of the front door camera and it won’t record it (and I got some smooth moves) but it might catch a bee buzzing by or every other car that happens to drive down the street. Pretty much garbage as far as security cameras go, you might as well pay someone to sit and peak out of a window and report back to you what is happening outside, that would be better than these cameras.

title: Excellent
text: I have three cameras to check on my animals. Two in a dusty chicken coop. The work incredibly well in all weather. The audio is quite good too. Had I purchased these before installing an ADT security system I’d have done my home with blink cameras as their quality is much better than the ADT cameras. I’ve not had to replace the batteries yet and it’s been over a year. I recommend these to my friends all the time. Very nice product.

title: Bad buy!
text:
Hasn’t been a year camera is unresponsive. I’m disappointed with this product. I’m so embarrassed I even recommended this to my neighbor and they have the same issues as mine.

Problem with Blink is delay feed. Once it alerts you via notification and you attempt to open the app to view the cam it’s too late to catch the action. Now if the camera picks up and record there is also a delay. If you changed the settings to a point of sensitivity it detects even any bug that flies and cross the camera path resulting in false alarm. This cam cannot detect the difference between humans and bugs in comparison to my other cam that does.

title: Need Upgrades
text: I have had Blink for over 2 years; I like it but would like to see some upgrades. I wish that it did not light up when recording. I used it at my business and whenever I would be away from my Business and would look “live”, there is a small light on the camera that would light up which would obviously let someone know that they are being watched in real-time. And sometimes it takes a few tries to enable the camera’s, or at least that’s the experience that I have had.

title: Glitchy update
text: We have had the Blink XT four camera system for about 6 months. Cameras have worked well until the last update. One camera has developed a problem with no sound. Blink was nice enough to replace it although we still have sound issues with it. In addition, the new software has caused motion not be detected occasionally. Picture frames also freezes from time to time. Customer service has been helpful but was unable to correct these problems. Awaiting the next update to see if the software issues are resolved.

title: Worst customer service
text: Camera only worked 25 to 50 percent of the time. I contacted customer service and granted them permission to view my camera for 5 days and they did nothing. They keep sending me the same emails asking me to grant them permission. They don’t even read my emails. They have no toll free number to call and told me they are too busy to call me on the phone. I guess the reason they are too busy to call me is that they to many defective cameras out there. Now my camera doesn’t work at all and they have the nerve to tell me that I have to pay them for access. Don’t waste your money on these defective products that they sell.

title: No Multi-User Support
text:
I bought these cameras because they were wireless, a good price & had good quality picture. I’m probably going to just resell them at this point. The cameras work great, but the only way more than one person can use/view is by sharing the main account login/password. 

That means: 
- Everybody who has it has admin level control
- Things like notifications are yes/no for everyone
- No way to give access by group of cameras (e.g., this person can see outside cameras, that one can see inside)

I had assumed that there would be SOME degree of this available, if not all of it. But after setting up the cameras and app there was no was to add a user. Doing a Google search for help shows this has been a known issue for years, so it doesn’t sound like I should hold my breath waiting for them to fix this. 

It’s a shame: the camera & picture quality are quite good. I hoped to add a bunch more. But without this feature, the whole system becomes unusable for us.

title: Keeps getting worse and worse...
text:
I have used the Blink camera system for over a year now. At first I was impressed and the system worked great. Over time and frequent updates the system performance(especially battery life) has diminished greatly. With each update done I have seen the battery life get reduced further and further. The activation amount of the cameras per day has remained relatively the same though. It is at the point now where the cameras are becoming more of a hassle than they are worth. I have begun looking for a replacement system for the house. 
Wish I would of saved the money spent on the Blink System and just put that toward something more reliable.

title: Too many bugs
text: A camera app for home monitoring needs to work for the most basic function - viewing the camera - 100% of the time. This isn’t an arcade game, it’s home security. I have an iPhone X and this thing frequently says the camera is “busy” or “live view in progress” when I try to view the camera. If a live view was actually in progress then I wouldn’t be trying to view the camera, right? I can persistently get that message until I simply have to force close and restart the app. Just too buggy to be reliable. When the app actually works, it’s a nice app, it just simply fails to do so far too frequently.

title: Not great
text:
First, they advertise the batteries last 2 years.  Not even close!  Most of my batteries last 2 months max. Yes, I don’t have the settings set for the minimal battery usage, but those settings give you a useless video.
There is delay in receiving video which makes a quick response to what is on the video impossible.
Another problem is there is no way to record when you want to.  You have to rely on the motion sensor to start the recording.
Which leads to the next problem... the motion sensor is inconsistent.  Sometimes it will sense a wasp flying by but completely miss the car driving up the driveway.
I don’t recommend this product.

title: Doorbell delay
text: I just added the new video doorbell to my system. The image quality is great but I find the system buggy. When someone rings the doorbell I get a notification on my phone but when I tap that notification to open the system and communicate with the visitor I just get a spinning wheel. I have to close out of the app and re-enter it to connect. By that time the person who rang the doorbell has moved on. I also wish that my phone would do an audible chime when the doorbell is pressed.

title: Not bad but not great.
text:
Installed 3 of these last week. They are very easy to setup. The video quality during the day is great. At night, so so.
Not overly impressed with the notifications. Like another reviewer stated. It’s hit or miss. 
Still using the 30 day free trial for storage. Not sure if I’m going to subscribe or just use my own storage. It does give me some piece of mind though when I’m out and about. 
It’s only been a week, we will see how they hold up in the harsh New England winter.

title: good if you have 1 camera
text:
this app is Ho-rri-bull 
if you have multicameras set up as I do , you would already find it takes wayy too long to switch between cameras .
if youre using these cameras fir home security, Dont rely on monitoring too much or at all if you are looking to view around your house quickly .

terrible . i do not recommend the app or product

title: Not the best but not the worse
text:
I actually like these little cameras.  What I don’t like is the app.  You can only arm or disarm all the cameras in the group.  If you want to arm just one camera (like my front door or driveway when I’m home) you have to put them in their own group. That then throws Alexa a curve ball because she really only likes you to have one group.  
If they could fix that issue I think they would be a great option for a lower cost security system.

title: Latest update randomly crashes
text:
Was forced to download the latest update today to continue using, and at random times after using the app for 1-2 mins, it simply crashes.  Please fix this ASAP, in the few times I’ve used it today, it’s crashed about 4 times.  No special pattern, just navigate back and forth into various menus and it will crash.

Also, the new pop down at the top when performing any arming/disarming action is super annoying, on an iPhone especially it blocks the running man icon when at the top until it auto dismisses.  Give us a way to turn that little feature off.

title: Review
text: I have had my system for almost 9 months.  I’m thinking even a 2 star rating may be to high.  I have had numerous times when the wife is on the garage and in the house before so get an alarm.  My one camera monitoring my shop only detects half the time.  It may detect me going to the shop but not back or visa versus.  I installed an extender and even that doesn’t help that camera.  All four cameras are seeing a full internet and full sync module.  The batteries definitely do not last two years.  About 6-8 months under normal use.  I only run two of the cameras when I’m home.

title: First year review
text:
Santa brought us a camera setup which I installed on our front door. 
Activates for all deliveries and I get quite clear night shots with no porch lights on. 
Still on first battery and is rated “Good”.  Especially like the ability to turn off motion detection for certain areas of the picture. That way it doesn’t activate when I open the door to check the porch but does activate for deliveries.

title: Live view takes longer than expected
text: I love the cameras and I love the app, but if someone knocks on my front door it takes too long to connect. I get a notification like a minute, maybe a minute and a half after the knock then I click to go to live feed and it takes another minute or so, by that time the person gets antsy and starts walking away and I have to do the whole speaker “Can I help you” thing. Is there anyway to fix the delay? My internet is 200+ MBPS so it’s not my connection.

title: Super easy to install, app needs some improvements.
text:
Nice alternative to ring with the no monthly costs for cloud support and super easy to install.  My only criticisms include the lack of a “select all” option when attempting to clear notifications on multiple recordings.    With this app each recording must be selected individually in order to clear the notification.  

One other complaint is that the thumbnails don’t provide recent images. When the app is opened, the user has no idea when the images shown on the thumbnail were taken.

title: Live Feed
text: Ever since the last update, that I was I required to do mined you, nothing has been working! Trigger time literally takes minutes longer. I don’t get a notification till we’ll after someone has walked all the way up our front steps and knocked on our door. What is the point of having the camera at that point?! The live feed doesn’t work at all period! My husband and I both get a message saying “live feed failed.” Again, defeats the WHOLE purpose of having the camera. Probably going to start shopping around for a more reliable camera system. Thanks for wasting our money!

title: Love, but needs a snooze button for disabled feature
text: Absolutely love the Blink system. And, the ability to disable all cameras with 1 easy access button is great; however I’d love to see a snooze button option added. Like, 10-15 minutes or you choose how long ... Can’t tell you how many times I disable the cameras to let the dog out and totally forget to turn it back on ... for hours.

title: Why no changes?
text: The product itself works pretty well. However, this app is pretty lame. I understand why some limitations exist like schedule by camera. That’s a hardware limitation. But why we can’t select many videos and mark as read? That’s unacceptable and maddening. I’ve been a user for years hoping this one thing would change but nope. No way to select videos by grouping. Just select all or deselect all. Really limited. I’m not sure what the product owners and development team are doing over there but they aren’t enhancing the mobile app. That’s for sure.

title: Just bad
text: I've had these cameras for over a year, they just get worse and worse. The light on the camera attracts outside bugs and lizards, besides the wind, bugs are the only notifications I get. You can walk right past them and get no motion detection. I set them to the highest sensitivity but still get nothing, nothing but nature, wind trees rain etc. Human movement and cars, I get nothing. If I do manage to get a notification about movement, it's 2 minutes after you've walked past the camera and into the house. Batteries on all 3 cameras are dead every 30 days, sometimes 25.

title: Good system, but major flaw
text:
Great system and very good app to manage cameras. However .... the notification sound just a quiet single ding and you cant change it, what means the whole system becomes useless for the security purposes.. It wont wake you up if you sleeping and whats the point to have cameras and motion sensors if its not alerting you when needed? 
Unfortunately there is no option in the settings to change that sound. Hope developers will address that soon. Otherwise its a good system.

title: Won’t Work Without Update
text: I liked my Blink cameras a lot until now they won’t work for me at all.  My phone has iOS 12.4. The Blink cameras won’t work unless you have 12.5 and there is no way to update to 12.5. I do not want to update to 14 so now they just won’t work. Have never had an app that won’t work because of my iOS. It should still work with the previous update. Disappointed. I can’t even see the previous videos. But it still dings. Not sure if it is recording something or not since I can’t use the app at all. A blank white screen. Not good.

title: Crashes and lots of buffer
text:
A lot of this is due to greed, plain and simple.

If Blink didn’t work backwards and have their cameras upload footage to the cloud then back down to your devices, you wouldn’t have horrible lag and other network issues. But they do it like this because then you have no choice but to buy a subscription. Because offline storage is superior in every way and doesn’t give them any monetary incentive.

I can’t take this. I rely on my camera to know that my family and my property is safe. If this app acts this way, this is unacceptable and I need to get another camera.

I can’t rely on 11 seconds to properly give me enough time to do anything. I can’t rely on all this horrible lag and buffering.

And now the app crashes when trying to view a stream. Something is going on at my home right now and I have no clue because this app is crashing.

This is outrageous.

title: A great camera to see...
text:
We have had these two cameras over a year.  We are very happy with them all in all. 
      They work well most of the time and the picture quality is good too.
       I just wish they were more accurate in the time between when they trigger and when the movement happens.  It is almost a full minute between movement and the chime I receive the notifacation.  
      I will continue using them for they do work.

title: Missing key features
text:
Got home security this app is missing some very needed features. Geolocation: It really needs to support automatic arming when you leave your home location. Family support: It needs to support access by multiple people. If geolocation were supported, it would as need to support arming if the last person left but not arm if someone is still home. 

Optional but nice features would be the ability to put cameras in groups and perhaps arm “outdoor” cameras while leaving indoor cameras disarmed.

title: More user friendly features please
text:
I really struggle with why I can’t select multiple videos and delete at once. It is so annoying to delete one at a time.
Also it would be great to be able to enable/disable multiple cameras at once. Currently user needs to click each camera and enable and save. Takes forever. If I do not want to disable the whole system, I should be able to easily pick and choose which ones will be active.

title: Simple, stable and great.
text:
Been using it for over two years now. 
Very happy with it, but it would be better only if you guys change the colors of the “ armed / disarmed “ to other colors than brag and blue, why not use tow other colors that have better contrast. 
I have 4 camera and it’s hard to see which one is armed and which one is disarmed because at a glance the small
Icons in blue or gray look the same.

title: Blink Camera XT
text: I have 4 cameras and they are working great. One camera failed and Blink systems replaced it with a new one however the quality of the camera is great during the day and night.  The only problem I have is sending a video clip by text message. I’m an IPhone user and sometimes it works sometimes it doesn’t. I reported it to see if they can fix it.  I’m able to send the video clip through email as a workaround. I would really like to see they fix the bug of text messaging.

title: Ridiculous!
text: Sensitivity, visibility, sound settings are set very very low. However still dinging movement every few seconds, battery changes required at 3 weeks. Did I mention the ‘DINGING!.’ Battery NEVER reads ‘full charge’ again after first reload. Wind and the invisible man cause constant motion to activate. Very very difficult to set up and block out high use motion sensing without the places that are important. Very time consuming to operate. Really? There has GOT to be a better product than this. Purchased five cameras and need one more but not getting to another one.

title: VERY Buggy
text: No longer reliable enough to serve it’s primary function, DO NOT BUY THE CAMERAS unless they fix the app—your user interface that makes the system essentially useless.  Used to be quite good, and reliable, but is now completely unreliable.  It, more times than not, freezes so you cannot get camera videos, it alerts, but there is no video recorded, and the app just wont load about 50% of the time now.  The camera seem to work well and batteries last a long time, but a camera at the door wont work well as it doesn't detect motion directly towards the door.  Because of that camera failure I would give this 3 stars if the app worked.

title: Not bad.
text: This is a camera that is good for places that don't have a lot of people walking around. Living in NYC that's not the case. I have the camera at sensitivy of 5-6 and it dies in two days. I livw in Brooklyn so it's not as crowded as Manhattan but the camera still dies pretty quickly. But for what it does, it works fine. Battery is one of the main issues for me. Also the app needs to allow me to only delete viewed footages or unviewed footage. It's annoying I have to keep swiping to delete each footage.

title: 2+ years and counting!
text: I’ve had this Camera system in my home for about 2 1/2 years, and I have absolutely no complaints! The settings have many customizable perks. The microphone captures everything and the best part is I can speak to who ever is at the door without actually coming into contact with anyone. Definitely adding more for the inside of my home

title: Reliable notifications are a total miss
text:
The motion detection is great up close but if you place cameras on a second story to capture activity leading up to your property, it’s not as good. A secondary motion detector would be a welcome addition to assist these cameras. 

The notifications are also quite lacking. A delivery person can come up and place a package and leave before you even get a notification, even with ‘early notification’ marked in preferences. So, talking to an intruder or a delivery person is likely not going to happen. 

Also, battery life is hit or miss. I’ve had 2 out of 4 cameras need batteries replaced 2 times in less than 6 months with standard settings. 

Bugs love theses cameras as well and seem to set of the motion detection very frequently. I imagine this could be corrected in the software but has not been yet.

title: Live view in progress is irritating
text: We live in the woods and every time I hear something I go to look on our camera and see what or who it is since we don’t get many visitors. And it says live view in progress please wait . Well by the time it comes up whatever or whoever is there is gone or at the front door .  Also there was no mention of needing to pay for cloud service when I bought these off of qvc. We hooked a memory stick to take care of that . I bought cheaper camera that’s just as good or better .”

title: Not bad at all
text:
I was actually surprised by the picture and video quality both day and night. I also like that I can move the cameras around easily because of the battery power and wireless connection. 

What I would like to see is more camera control such as zoom, wide angle and how about a unit with some lens motion. Wouldn’t have to be slot of movement but some would be nice.

title: Worthless… Sending it back
text: Everything worked for about five minutes. I got a crisp, HD view when I was holding the 1st camera in my hand, and testing before install. That was short-lived. The cameras are now not working. Not one of the three! If I click “live view“ icon, it says “camera busy“. When I click the “take a picture“ icon, that doesn’t work either. I don’t know if the app is buggy or what, Or if it’s the equipment. But everything is installed correctly, and not a single thing on the app works. I did get a bunch of “motion detected“ text messages, so those momentarily worked as well.

title: Great system with easy setup!
text:
Got the five camera system and had it up and running in just a couple hours time 👍
Just wish it had a couple missing features:
1 - wish there was a timer function for arming the system automatically between set times.  Have to remember to manually set it each evening
2  would be nice to have a feature to save live feed snapshots or vid clips rather than having to arm the system and hope the motion detector grabs the feed

title: Descent
text:
I don’t have a cloud storage plan and utilize a simple USB for storage. Randomly when clips (motion detected) are found the clips can’t be viewed since they weren’t saved due to not having a storage plan — even though I utilize a usb. This happens every so often. Also when it actually stores clips on the usb there isn’t a “delete all” option like in cloud storage. 

3 stars until basic functionality is back. But I’m sure it is intentional to push customers toward a subscription.

title: Crap
text: This camera company is over priced for crappy products. They offered something good but the systems never stay working. My cameras video quality is superb battery life even with cheap batteries is still pretty decent. The cameras however are trash always having issues cameras aren’t responding. Customer service is crap offer no help at all. My cameras are less than a year old and just never stay working and they’re set up right next to the module. I have another wifi camera set up in the back yard never stops working but those front cameras are trash and not worth the outrageous price!

title: Disappointing
text: My family and I loved our outdoor cameras. However recently there was a new IOS update where the app was no longer compatible with older IOS. My parents do not need new phones however it prevents them from updating to the new IOS. They have used this app for the safety of the household and for them to know when their children get home. It’s honestly just disappointing because it’s not like updating the app helps with camera quality of the product.

title: OK, needs several fixes.
text: Live views fail often(I have max bars to WiFi and sync module). Videos are magically recording without viewing the cameras or motion occurrences(this started after an update recently) which takes up a lot of space if I don’t make sure I delete them. Misses basic motion all the time(like cars, people walking in front of the camera). I’ve adjust the settings and still never gets any better. Hard to be a trillion dollar company wrote this software.

title: Stay away!!!!!!
text: If it have a zero stars will give them. Do not spent your money for garbage.... Set up was so fast and easy just it is good about this camera, installed it outside to monitoring my car  in front of home and try different way to adjust a recording video, nothing happens.
