title: Wish it had more options but otherwise good
text: I have had 7 blink cameras for more than a year. The scheduling, independent cameras, would be a great benefit. The all of them or none of them recording on a schedule, is the only thing I dislike. They sometimes are slow to begin recording, and you know someone entered the frame but you only see them as they are exiting the frame, like there is a delay in the recording initiation. I believe that the other features of the cameras are good.

title: App has functional issues
text:
This app has a few (transient) issues during loading live view and update camera settings.

The latency to load live view is really high, can be up to 10s, with my home wifi of 500 Mb/seconds. And some times, it failed to load live view after a long loading screen.

Some times, I just don’t like waiting them to be loaded, then I closed the live view and back to camera selection screen. But it still shows me live view in progress, when I attempt to update some camera configurations. Exiting the live view means, functionally the process to load live view should be terminated, is it? Why it still shows live view in progress even if I explicitly close out the function.

Blink smart camera is having a good looking design, I really hope the tech team could make some improvements over the app. Thanks.

title: App problem
text:
I have had the blink cameras for a few years and have got roughly 6 months + of battery life. The only thing that I don’t like is I have to log into the app every week as a new user. This only started about the time they upgraded the app. This is a real nusance. Also the app states that I have a video that I haven’t seen (yellow dot) When I do a search for the video I generally find that the video is about a week or two old, and it appears out of nowhere.
Every day I have to sign in as a new user. Something wrong with this app.

title: App plays camera audio when motion detected?
text: Since the latest version (6.1.4), I’ve noticed that when one of cameras detects motion and starts recording, I hear and see the usual notification, *and* I hear the sound that the microphone is picking up, even when my phone is locked.  Is this something that can be disabled?  It’s annoying. I don’t see a way to turn it off in the Blink app settings, or in notifications in iOS (14.3).

title: Great
text:
I cannot get over people that buy blink and compare it to the best. Get real. They are not ring or other great system. But without them I would have nothing but a barking dog and he doesn’t say much. Blink fills the great need for people who had a poor signal. I have had the big boys laugh at me. Get blink who cares if they do not last two years it depends on usage. Best ever for people on the edge of no where. 
Yes

title: Love seeing wildlife
text: Living in the mountains my dog would hear noises at night. Now I have strategically located cameras to see raccoons, coyotes, and last summer, several huge bear. Had pictures to show Airbnb so they secured their trash cans. The cameras Even worked during colder snowstorms than suggested. I also like knowing ahead of time, when deliveries or friends are arriving. I live in Safe area, except for the bears (usually walking through at night on the thruway below my bedroom)!!

title: Notification Sound
text: Hello, I love everything about this camera except the notification sounds. It does not differ at all from a regular app on iOS, thus we don’t receive the audible cue that “hey someone is in my front yard”. If I was able to set the sound to the Alarm ringtone I would instantly know what is happening. Also it would wake me up at night! Fix this and Blink will be one of the best security systems you can buy!

title: App reliability is sub-par
text: The cameras seem fine: nice range on motion detection, clear picture, good sound quality, and two-way talk works. All of that requires the app loading properly and also connecting to the cameras if the app actually does open. On the same WiFi as the cameras, the app still opens less than a third of the time, making early notification a novelty at best, and live view often generates an error. The system would probably be better if it could be accessed through a website, as the app doesn’t work a majority of the time. 1 star because you can’t rate lower. Disappointing.

title: Terrible picture quality, app crashes, WiFi issues
text:
Thus far this has been a total piece of junk.

The cameras can’t manage a minimal connection with my WiFi even though they are only 15 and 20 feet from the router in a direct line of sight with nothing to block them on a network that has no problem serving every other device up to 10 times the distance through walls and across the street even.  Regardless of connection, the system is painfully slow to execute commands.  The image quality is useless and at its best gives you the clarity and resolution of a circa 1995 webcam.  Support seems to be a joke.  Don’t waste your money.

title: Now requiring storage plan
text: Bought a couple of blink camera and system and was fairly happy with it, I was able to view recordings and listen. Now with this new update its telling me that it no longer records because I don’t have a blink storage plan. Well why didn’t you tell me that before I bought the system? Spent tons of money and now you’re requiring a storage plan? Doing the customers wrong by deceiving them, waiting for people to buy the camera  system and now making this absurd requirement on this new update! PS: I bought this camera system December 2020! This is crazy!

title: Made me obsolete
text:
This is my first camera “SECURITY SYSTEM” 

I have had it over a year and had little problems. However around March 15,2021 they had an ups that left my system unusable for my device. 

Their remedy was to get a new phone or view unknown videos from. Completely negating the security.

The call was recorded. The rep wasn’t in America and read from a script. I said how does your company making changes to a working system that leaves it unusable. 

The cameras are good at catching the end movements of whatever sets the motion off. 

They do work well for turning them on manually if you hear something. And the update in Jan 2021 was nice so it auto saves the manual turn on videos. 

However. There are reasons you don’t see blink online showing things as regularly as others. 

I will not buy another blink system if the company is worse than Apple for making functional equipment unusable by an unnecessary update.

title: Is this only for 1 phone?
text:
I was so disappointed when I tried to load all my information, to only find out that it can only be viewed by 1 device. My husband had already downloaded the app and the camera information. When I tried to do it, it said that this information already belongs to another user. So I guess my husband only has access to the camera but I don’t 😠 What’s the point of having it? So if someone rings the doorbell, I’d have to call/text my husband, to check who it is then he would have call/text me back?? 
Perhaps you have a better solution. 🤷🏽‍♀️

title: Defective camera
text: I bought the system about a year ago, had a problem with one of the camera using up batteries every couple of weeks. Can not get any help in sending it back for warranty. It is like they don’t want you file or they simply don’t want to make it good . I like the system and would buy it again but support is lacking.

title: Great camera.
text: Most of the reviews I’ve read on here about this app and the cameras are silly. People are either tech stupid or complain about the smallest things. Affordable, great video quality, you do not need subscription after trial if you researched a bit. Great connectivity and overall if any issues do occur are minor and common with any camera out there.

title: Invading privacy
text:
My cameras were working fine until I got contacted by a very strange email from support.
They insisted I have serial numbers that I don’t and want to replace the cameras. They want my physical address which of course could be of value to a hacker looking to perhaps use the cameras to assist in burglary or worse.  Now my app is completely crippled unless I update the iOS. It offers to download the latest compatible version but just goes in circles when try to do so.
I’m asking for a full refund of 5 cameras since things were working just fine until the”proactive “ support emails.

title: System is sow
text:
The best thing about Blink is that it doesn’t require a monthly payment like majority of the Security systems do. 

But the recorded videos are only 5sec long and I don’t see an option to extend the length of what’s recorded and it takes a long time for the live video to load, it’s about a 10-12 second pause before the live stream shows and again you only get 5 seconds to view before you have to tap to view the live recording again..

title: System selector is inconvenient
text:
The new System selector is bad, bad, bad. I have five Systems and the old list was MUCH better. It took far less work to go from System-to-System - no scrolling needed.

Most importantly, I used to be able to see all the System statuses at the same time. Now? Not. I have to slide-and-select each System in order to see whether it’s armed or disarmed.

Please bring back (something like) the old at-a-glance System selector. Maybe replace the sliding banner with a pull-down?

title: Clips no longer visable
text: VERY DISAPPOINTED that the latest update eliminated allowing me to see the videos listed per camera.  I now need to open a blank box to see the video. This all happened when my free cloud account expired. I want my videos saved on a USB instead of relying on Blink to keep them private. With all of the hacking going on a person needs to control what is out there and “hope” that their cloud server is secure. Its bad enough that Blink sells my info as it is.

title: Needs work but good for the price of the product
text: The app works alright. I wish it was a little more intuitive. There sometimes are just to many layers to go through. It is something stable. But the camera frequently can't be viewed. It sometimes feels like it doesn't apply changes. Even though it says that it has applied them. There is still some odd stuff.

title: Issue with latest update on XT cameras
text:
Product has been 5-stars for both XT (1st-gen) & XT2 (2nd-gen) cameras until latest update, which has caused our XT cameras from picking up movements and recording video.

The XT2 cameras still work normally capturing and recording movement and we can still get the live view to work on all cameras, (XT & XT2), but automatic recording of video from movement no longer works on our original XT cameras, we even tried restarting the Sync Module, but there was no change.

Please correct this issue!!

title: I want more!!
text: This product is awesome. I have 7 total cameras including 2 new minis. The app however is pretty basic. Wish it had a lock video option for ones I want to keep within the app. Also wish the live view lasted until I ended it. Having to continuously hit continue is really annoying. Also, wish when you entered the app and you see your active cameras you could scroll through all of them as live views and select the specific camera to enlarge. Seems archaic and in need of a serious face lift.

title: Support is not helpful
text:
A few weeks ago the app started sending notifications when the scheduled arm and disarm occurs, even though this notification is disabled in the app.  Support does not understand what I’m telling them.  They suggested rebooting the router, then asked which camera isn’t working.

The next support rep said it’s a known issue and reinstalling the app will correct – he was wrong.  This is irritating.

I sent another email to support as requested and the response did not resolve the issue.

Second email response from support ‘ We sent a signal to the camera's, please try to check if its working. If issue persist, please try to use a different phone to access the system and compare if its still the same with the different phone.’

The issue is not with the camera, it pertains to notifications sent from the app.  What gives?

title: Easy to use!
text: Finally something that anyone can really install and actually works once you have it up. I love it. There were a few hiccups with the distance between my cameras in the box but I’ve since gotten two boxes which has helped with that. I love the new app update that has caused me to add a star everything is way more accessible now!

title: Lot of room for improvement
text: The camera vision quality is not bad since the camera is not that expensive. but the live camera version is the worst I wish there something could be done for this problem. It will take a long time to view live camera version and it will always always stop every single seconds. The battery mine run out in a month which supposed to last for two years.

title: Happy Customer
text: I couldn’t be more happy with this product. I was on the waiting list before they released the indoor camera and the outdoor version. Adding a second sync module gave me so much more flexibility. I now have the outdoor cams on at all times and the indoor cams when we leave for work and school. Way less expensive than the arlo, but with similar features. I will add them to my vacation property soon too.

title: So frustrating!!!!
text: I know this may be because of the new version, but it won’t even let me log in. I had to go to the website to create my account because the app doesn’t allow me to. And then when I try to login on the app it says invalid credentials! I called their technical support and sat on hold with the most annoying repetitive soundbite intended to make you hang up… Which I did after 20 minutes with no answer. I have been working on this for over an hour with no progress! I hear these new security cameras I got are great but that doesn’t mean anything if I can’t use them with the app. Hey app support people… Help me!!!

title: Local storage (usb) function broken
text: The function of local storage on usb drive became more and more unreliable after several recent updates of the application (and perhaps also because of firmware updates on the Blink devices too, I can't verify because the firmware update is unmanaged). Finally the most recent update made the local storage completely broken. Very bad user experience. I invested $500 for the whole set of Blink system in the fall of 2020 and now the system is completely useless if I don't pay for monthly subscription. Well done on your scheme Blink!

title: Disgusted with this Junk Security System
text: I have had blink for about 1 year. They worked well for maybe 30-45 days. I had 4 cameras. Started out 4 worked then 2 worked. Changed batteries an reprogrammed them an 3 worked. Numerous times I contacted Blink service an they gave items to do, a total joke an none worked. Now the app has been upgraded so won’t work with my phone unless I upgrade the App. I can’t wait until QVC has them in again so I can give my opinion of this Junk. I’m happily carrying them out to my garbage can an installing a wired in system. Total a Total Garbage.

title: It’s…ok
text: The first thing I’d have to say is I get a ton of blanks clips where nothing happened. Meaning something happened but it captured it too late.  The next thing I hate the most is it’s hard to communicate with someone at the door. For one, for some reason sometimes it asks for the password randomly. It doesn’t happen often but when it does it’s super annoying and useless. The picture is pretty good. I have to give them that.

title: Happy with the functionality
text: Have had the camera in place (regular one, not the black one) for some months now and very happy with it. I wish there was a functionality to mark videos as “seen”. I get a lot of videos by normal activity and the only way to reset the badge on the app icon is to delete them all, which I don’t want. Also I wish they included more detail in the version history and not just “bug fixes”.

title: Works great for me!
text: I give it 4.5 stars in reality and it would be five stars, but for one feature request. An indicator on the devices screen to show if a camera is currently being viewed. My wife and I use them around the house and it would be helpful to know at a glance if I need to check in on the kids or if my wife already is.

title: Can we have the old software back?  Please?
text:
This is the only app I’ve ever seen where the update makes it harder and more tedious to do things.  Isn’t it the point of an update to make it more efficient?  Since the update:
1. Takes you three times as many clicks just to delete one video and then open the next one.
2.  Impossible to scrub video, if you need to take a screenshot forget it.  You can’t drag the bar without deleting other videos in your list. 
3.  Have to go find the trashcan now, it isn’t just there in the window, it is inside the video where the commands are all over the place.  After you go find it, you delete and it takes you back to the list instead of moving to the next.
4.  Hard to take screenshots because the play button and other graphics are over everything.

Can you please make the option available for us to go back to the old software if we want to?

title: Constant App crashing is very annoying!!
text: The Blink camera system is great, the problem is the Blink Home App on my iPhone even my wife’s iPhone the Blink app once in a while crashes which is very annoying and for the past few days there were more crashes when we click on our camera view and going into the app settings it would crash. I have the latest iPhone app version of 4.0.10. I am guessing maybe this app isn’t optimized for IOS 12 iPhones. Please update this app and fix the annoying app crashing, it is getting on our nerves!

title: Simple, just needs one feature
text: Batteries last well, easy to set up, easy to manage. The only drawback is trying to keep outdoor cameras from tripping with too many false alarms but still viewing your needed areas. ie if you’re watching the driveway cars in the street will trip it all day and night. This could be fixed easily with a common feature allowing you to pick areas in the field of view that will not trip motion.

title: Skip these. Look for something better.
text: Don’t be fooled. You can’t schedule the arming of individual cameras. The camera’s suffer from condensation making them often unusable in the mornings outside. Last and certainly the killer, you cannot define motion detection zones for cameras. This means if you have a bush or a tree in view you will be getting so many alerts that you’ll give up viewing them. The police called me to say they were arresting a man in my front yard. I missed it because i was getting an alert every minute from 3 cameras. Ok indoors but absolutely useless outside.

title: Cameras are fine but App needs more features
text:
I understood the cameras would have limitations : clip length, no continuous viewing, sensitivity adjustments. And so far I've been relatively satisfied with the cameras. 

The app needs some more features. I can't update the still photos of all the cameras at the same time. I'd like to open the app and have an option to uodate all camera still photos to observe any changes that may have taken place. You have to update the photo, wait for the progress wheel to finish, then click on the next photo. If you have several cameras this gets very tedious. 

There should be a app shortcut to arm and disarm the system instead of waiting for the whole app to launch and boot up. 

These are my primary recommendations and I'd love to bring up my rating.

title: Good camera, decent UI
text:
I really enjoy these. They have done exactly what I wanted. Plus a ton of functionality to edit the cameras modes and sensitivity etc. 
I would like to make a few notes on the App that I would like to see added and changed. 
The “arm/disarm” function is great, but I’d love to be able to make a camera active(when it’s armed) even when the cameras are in disarm mode 
A widget function to quickly arm and disarm without loading the entire app
Tweaking the playback section slightly to delete videos without reverting to the list UI. It’s jarring and slows down deleting videos. 

I love these cameras and the app has a ton of functionality. Those minor inconveniences add up but I would buy more in a heartbeat.

title: The worst.
text:
Absolutely the worst cameras/system you can get. I would recommend you staying FAR away from Blink. With all of their new and old cameras, I would say the only good use case for them is to see if a dog was in your yard at a certain time. The system and cameras are complete trash.

See a squirrel, wait 15 minutes until he his done eating nuts before you will see it. Not to mention the notifications are so dang annoying. You have to watch or delete each one to get rid of the notification(s).

And battery life- good luck getting six months max out of each one.

title: Poor application for the good camera system
text:
First of all, you cannot have multiple users at all. There should be minimal support for multiple people over multiple systems. You can have one system for home and one for work, you obviously would not want to share your home cameras with your coworkers. 
Second, you can only access one camera at a time. For example, you can not update screenshot of the cameras all at once.
Third, there should be cloud storage offer for those who are interested. Free limited storage is good but it should allow extending limits.

title: Ok.  Inexplicably unreliable
text: App is fine in terms of settings and management.   However some videos and cameras are inexplicable inaccessible sometimes.  Sync module online, all cameras good wireless strength, storage capacity only 1%, but videos will just not play.   Some do, some dont, and the ones that dont are then magically accessible a few hours later.  Sometimes a camera with full strength wont load either, but other cameras at same location are fine.

title: Blink System
text: Best bang for the buck! I have the 4 camera system and it literally took under 15 minutes to get it up and running. I made brackets to hang under my soffets and these small cameras deliver great quality for a fraction of the cost. The only drawback is you can't speak thru them...you can hear everything very clearly though. Don't hesitate to purchase this system, you won't be sorry.

title: Frustrated Customer / Terrible App
text: I have used the Blink equipment for a couple of years and this app is beyond terrible. You would think after this much time they’d get the bugs worked out. Clearly that isn’t a priority for them as long as they keeping selling cameras. Still no online UI either. They should at least offer that since the app is below sub-par. Numerous issues having alerts record properly or even archiving in the history. Wishing I hadn’t spent money on cameras for 2 homes. Recommended advice: Go with a better company and save yourself the headache.

title: Good but need improvement
text:
I will try to rate on the app only and not the camera like so many people did on their reviews.   I had it for about 2 months now and it does its job but the app needs improvements on the following :
- no schedule ability.   Either you turn it on or off.  Other apps like arlo gives the ability to turn it off/on based on customizable schedule.  
- not as intuitive compared to arlo
- Appearance of the app on iPad is terrible.   Not maximizing the space.

title: No app for older iPhones
text: I can no longer use the app because I choose not to update my iOS since I have a lot of legally downloaded music at risk when I update (backing up and restoring the songs resulted in over 12 hours of work during the last update). Blink will not allow me to download an earlier 2 month old update that works with the older IOS. I believe the update is required because they want my updated phone number and email address to sell to spammers. I will convert to a new camera system that has better notifications - good bye Blink.

title: Good system
text: In general I’d say this is a good system. Picture quality is good. Night vision is good. Very simple to install (or add)a camera. I’m sure there are better wired systems but for the money the blink system works well. There has been times I’ve had connection problems, but nothing critical. The application is ok nothing special and could be improved on. I like the system for my need. 3 1/2 stars overall.

title: Great camera but...
text:
Since the latest Apple iOS update, I cannot get the module or the camera to sync for the life of me. Went through all the trouble shooting, tried multiple times. Took batteries out, even put in new ones. Made sure device was on the same WiFi as my phone. 

When it works it did the job! Overpriced when you can get a Wyze Pan Cam that has two way audio, panning, motion tagging, and better picture quality. This is the route I went with since the Blink Xt stopped working after 2 months and the last update.

title: Great and easy
text: I agree i have seen some of these reviews and wonder what they bought!  It was not the same blink products i have.  Set up could not have been easier ( i also have nest and had ring cameras).  The app is very easy to use and customize.  Pic quality is great both day and night.  Alerts can be turned on or off and you don’t pay to hold the clips.

title: By the time you get notified and the lag in opening the camera intruder gone
text: I like the ease of set up and placement. Unlike another reviewer, I do get notifications. The problem is sometimes or many times the camera does not catch the intruder walking right past it. The worst feature that I hope they fix is the big time lag between getting the notification and when you click to look, there is too long of a lag for the camera to load.

title: Room for improvement
text: Slow loading live stream.. super glitchy (no matter how strong the WiFi connection is) I have WiFi extenders all around my house & have tested my connection multiple times & it is as close to perfect as could be so it’s not an issue on my end... next I really wish I could view all my cameras live feed at the same time.. individually they take too long to load.. other than that they were super easy to set up & the motion detector alerts are on point

title: Very near perfect
text: I’ve used the Blink cams for a while now and for the most part they work as expected and I have no complaints. One small technical glitch seems to have cropped up since the last update.  When using a Bluetooth earpiece or headphones when playing back a video, the audio switches over to the phone speaker.  Audio from the video will not play through the headphones.  A small matter, but odd.

title: F
text: Camera system is decent for the money, however the app is terrible. When your in the trial period it’s good, but as soon as the trial expires they neuter the app trying to force you to sign up for the cloud service. Cant delete multiple items, cant save live views, recently they’ve done it again. They removed the swipe and hold to delete from the app, now it’s multiple presses and wait to delete individual clips. That or take the usb out and delete it with a computer which is just stupid when the app is capable of doing it during the trial.

title: Blink earns all five stars ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
text: Yes blink is not your normal cctv setup, it’s better. I can put a camera anywhere. I’ve got one in my tree pointed at my home. No distractions or breaching my neighbors privacy as it’s only pointed at my property. Need free storage get a 64gb drive for on site video storage. Set a camera schedule and all is handled from there. Without hesitation blink gets my five stars.

title: Terrible experience
text: I’m a very tech savvy person and I spent about two hours trying to setup this system. All while sitting at my dining table with all components in front of me. After about 5 tries the module decide to sync. And after trying to connect two different cams one at a time I couldn’t get them to connect to the network. I completely started over deleting and reinstalling the app. It took another 3 tries of doing the same exact thing for the module to sync again but the cameras would not sync no matter what I did. I’m returning this system.

title: What’s happened?
text: I had 5 working cameras then 1 quit working, contacted support and tried stuff it wouldn’t work.  I bought a new replacement camera it worked a couple days and quit working same as previous one. NOW the app doesn’t want to work!  I try to save or post video and it says it cat connect or it processing and it does NOTHING!  This was a good system but I don’t know what’s going on now.

title: Good
text: System is very user friendly. The start up cost is all that is required. Camera and system are clear and zoom able. My beef is with the time it takes to go live if needs be. Say you receive and alert. You push the live view and 3 minutes latter it comes up. I have an iPhone 8 with 64 memory. So it’s the system. BUT!!! For the money, ease of install, it’s a fine unit.

title: Could be better
text:
The Blink cameras are ok, but I wouldn’t purchase them again. The motion detection is really spotty. It there is t a large object loving like a car, you generally don’t get to capture the image.

As for the app, it has minimal functionality and could use more features. For instance, saving a video is convoluted. If you want to save multiple videos for a particular time period, it is a bunch of work. I would suggest adding a multiple select option like there is for deleting videos.

title: Decent cameras for home
text: Decent cameras for home use and price point. The only problem is they are not capturing everything. There are times I know someone has been in and out of the driveway, but the system didn’t capture it. For example, a car pulls in the driveway and camera activated, that same person/car leaves the driveway, in the cameras view, but it doesn’t trigger. Leaves you wondering how reliable they are in emergency situations.

title: Cameras won’t connect anymore
text: Cameras have full batteries, highest connection bars, but won’t respond anymore.  System worked mediocre when first bought.  The response time was around 10-15 seconds even with full bars, which was kind of frustrating.  Example: the delivery guy dropped off a package and was gone for a full 10 sec before it alerted me.  There is serious light washout with these cameras, forget putting them under a porch, you won’t be able to see more than a few feet.  Now neither camera will respond with full batteries and perfect connection, about 4 months old...sad

title: Fix this app!
text: I have an iPhone XS Max and with the new update the app is almost unusable to watch video. They have removed the ability to do anything while watching a video in landscape mode (hope you don’t want to pause, rewind, or fast forward!) With my phone upright I can’t grab the slider! Great to get an alert that a person is in your yard when you are not home, not great having no way to control the video you are trying to watch. Is that person breaking in or leaving a mailer? You may never be able to find out 🤷🏼‍♂️

title: Camera is Great; App Updates are Annoying
text:
Camera is totally great.  Takes AA Energizer Ultimate Lithium, lasts about 6 months with heavy use before needing battery replacement, easy to mount, wireless, nightvision, good picture, real time monitoring, lots of settings to suit your needs.  Love it.

App has one annoying flaw:  Everytime you update it, it requires you to sign into your account again.  Really, guys?  You can't save my password when you put out a new app update?

title: They are doing petty things to force you to subscribe!
text: I got blink because it didn’t need a subscription. Then they forced the subscription for cloud or use the USB. Ok I’ll use the USB. But you can’t save live views. I can live with that. Oh and now it takes twenty seconds for each ten second clip to load and says “USB clips take longer to load.” Final straw was when they removed the “delete all” option for USB files. I have to delete each ten second video manually. But if it’s a cloud video I can select all. I’m so done. I’m switching to ring. At least they are transparent.

title: Was working ok, no blink local storage does not work
text: Starting Thursday my Blink 64GB local usb storage connected to my module stopped working. It says my local storage is incompatible. I have called technical support 2 times and emailed them too but no response. They also limit your local storage so you cannot record live view, easily share video, and there is a pause because they tell you that local storage is slower than a cloud service. Just another way to get $120 dollars out of you. Buyer beware.

title: Do not buy!
text: Purchased this camera system because I was lead to believe it worked without a subscription fee. But that is incorrect. Now the app just tells me there is movement and I can not see a recording without paying a fee. They changed the product and the app that I purchased. I should have bought a real system instead of a wireless one from a bunch of crooks. I paid money for something I can no longer use. Why should I have to pay a subscription fee every month/year to use something I already purchased?

title: Alerts
text: I have a blink mini indoor camera and an outdoor camera. While motion alerts are useful for the outdoor camera I have dogs and cats so when I have alerts set on the mini I get motion alerts quite often I wish they had a sound alert option that could be used instead of only motion as I only really need to be alerted if the dogs are barking or if there is sounds of a break in etc. not necessarily an alert that the dog decided to scratch her ear.

title: Fine cameras; wish they had a home/away feature
text: The cameras have been great quality, and we’ve only had minor issues with video not capturing quickly enough despite the sensitivity setting being high. I wish there was an option for manually arming individual cameras, and I wish there was an automatic home/away arming function like most other smart home devices have.

title: Good but needs some capability!
text: The Blink camera is a very nice piece piece of hardware. It is really useful for monitoring your property and it was easy to set up. While useful, the app does not offer features to easily link the photos for saving or use in other apps. The still photo is particularly limited. It cannot be rotated to landscape and it cannot be saved except through using a screen copy.

title: Good but needs a little more
text:
My number one gripe:  the thumbnail image instead of showing live feed. I have several Foscams and the app for them allows me to view multiple LIVE feeds all at once. Get rid of the “thumbnail” image and just show the live feeds!!

Very exited to hear about the zone feature coming. I had to turn my cams sensitivity to low because it picks up motion from the background.  Please roll out this feature soon!

title: Blink is the best!
text: I have had blink cameras for about two years now. I started out with three but have added two more including a exterior camera. I couldn't be happier. No issues with the cold compromising the outside camera (It's currently 10f here). The temp monitoring is a great extra as well. No issues installing and setting  up . I am a tech illiterate male who is happier fixing the lawn mower than programming the thermostat.

title: Good Cameras, Horrible App
text:
Cameras work fine, and for what they cost I’m satisfied. 

The app is a different story. Since I didn’t want to be stuck paying $10/month for cloud storage I’d probably rarely (if ever) need, I added a high capacity flash drive to my system. 

Would it really have killed the developers to add a “Select All” and/or “Delete All” option in the section where locally stored videos are displayed? Or is this an attempt to get me to subscribe by simply wearing me down by deleting every video individually?

title: Poor notifications
text: I am running the latest version, but yet the notifications are horrible. I will get a notification on my lock screen that motion has been picked up. If I unlock my phone there are no badge notifications whatsoever. Also, if I click on the motion notification from my lock screen, it takes me to a live view of the camera rather than the video clip of the motion that was detected. That’s pointless if I’m quickly trying to pull up the video clip

title: No longer able to use app
text:
I used to LOVE our blink cameras but Blink chose to update their app and require a newer IOS than my phone is not able to download. Every time I try to open the app it says I’m blocked and required to update the app, when I try to I’m told I can’t update because the app requires iOS 12.5 or newer which my phone won’t allow(iPhone 7). I am complete unable to access the account. 

The solution is easy- most apps offer a version that’s compatible with older iOS, so those people can still use the app. PLEASE BLINK CHANGE YOUR IOS REQUIREMENTS!

title: Pretty basic
text: Besides the whole camera configuration process being extremely complicated and technical the app could benefit greatly from a few simple improvements to video playback which I suppose is the main feature. The scroll knob is virtually impossible to catch with a touch gesture on a regular phone screen. Playback in landscape dims the screen when scrolling, making it very difficult to screen a clip quickly if it’s a dark scene. Two easy wins. Do it please!

title: Blink Home Monitoring
text: For the price and ease of use the camera is very pleasing. You can zoom in while viewing a live feed, it has two way voice, and a solid night vision view. The only reason I am not giving a 5 star rating is because the app itself I feel is poorly laid out. It is easy, but not aesthetically pleasing. Also, if you have an Alexa based smart home, this camera system will work well for you.

title: Arm / Disarm feature

title: Happy Customer

title: Swipe to delete

title: All around I like the system.
text:

title: Not Secure
text: I have contacted Blink several times over someone accessing my cameras and watching my neighbors and myself. Blink says it is me. It is not me. title: Marginal

text:

title: Monthly plan after a year

title: Decent for home
