title: App is slow
text: Camera is great but the app is slow on all of my devices.  There is no way I could ever actually talk to anyone that approached my door, as they would already be gone by the time the feed actually showed up.  My Mom’s Nest notification takes you directly to the video.  This notification brings up the last live feed and then I have to click on the notifications at the bottom.. it’s cumbersome and inefficient.

title: Simple and easy to use
text: I just needed cameras for the outside of my house. These were super easy to set up and easy to learn the app. If you want something advanced with a lot of customization, this isn’t for you. But if you just need something easy and effective, this is it.

title: Thank you!
text:
I am in hospice and I appreciate having my Blink device. It makes me feel secure. I’ve had mine since 2018 and my husband just changed the batteries 
Plus, my husband will have video of me over the last two years of me decorating the front door for every holiday

title: Limited software capabilities
text: Although the setup is easy, the program options are very weak.  There is no way to manually record, it has to be set as “armed” and then only records by motion.  There is no way to record all motion but have alerts limited to certain time frames, alerts and recording are either on or off.  A few simple changes to the user interface would make a huge difference but actual program updates are few and FAR between.

title: Allow the live view to last however long
text: The app and camera is great. I would like the live view to last unlimited time and. It 5 minutes. So I’ll be able to record cause the camera doesn’t pick up everything and that break in between can make a differences.

title: App doesn't work on old devices
text: I am very upset they have disabled the app from working on my older apple devices.  I use an older iPad by my bed to see what is moving outside, but as of March 2021 the have not allowed me to clear the update software message; which it can't complete since it is no longer compatible with my older device. Bad business.  I understand security, at least give me a view option for my system.

title: Don’t waste money on these cameras
text: I set up my cameras and they worked, for 2 hours. Since then I haven’t been able to get them to work, I can’t log into the app or get support timely support. Over 3 hours after contacting them the only solution they have offered is to turn off my VPN, which I don’t even have. I have done more that that in the time it takes them to get back to me. If they fix the issue I’ll fix my review but as of now it stands at I will most likely return these cameras.

title: Too many bugs
text: They constantly introduce bugs, and take forever to fix them. For example, over a month ago they acknowledged they introduced a bug that sends bogus notifications on iOS every time a scheduled alarm is enabled or disabled (usually twice a day). Their “workaround” is to disable notifications, which renders the entire product useless. They have come out with three patches since they created this bug, but refuse to fix it. They simply don’t care about customers.

title: End Clip early function doesn’t work
text: I’ve read on the Blink Community that other users have the same issue as me where the “End clip early if motion stops” function does not work and that the remedy is to disable it. This is unacceptable and needs to be fixed ASAP as it negates your “don’t have to change the battery for 2 years” tagline. If you have the recording time set for 10 secs, enabling cuts off the clip at 4 secs, for example.

title: Mid-range cameras, low-quality app.
text:
There is no way to change the update the wifi password on these cameras without manually rejoining each and every one. 

The app doesn’t offer a dedicated network setting section.  Meaning anytime you change your home wifi password, you have to visit each camera, unmount it, press the reset button, rejoin the camera on the app, remount the camera, and reposition the viewing angle. 

Repeat that for every single camera.  

Other than that, they’re decent budget cameras for the price point.  The image quality is good, non-network controls are good, sound is terrible (but I never use this feature), and the mountability is great.

title: Good but lacking in some areas
text: Needs the ability to view live feed at home screen from all online cameras instead of a saved picture. Load times are quicker with other brands from what I’ve seen.  Otherwise it’s decent and easy to navigate through the options

title: Live view is useless
text:
In 2021 you would think a CCTV company could develop an APP where you can see thumbnails of the live views of your cameras.  It’s ridiculous that Blink does not have that feature.  The one thing I did like about my Night Owl system is you can just open it up and freakin LOOK at your cameras. That all there is to it.  Instead with Blink, I have to deal with “Live view failed” at least every other time I want to view a camera. 

BLINK, FIX THIS APP SO WE CAN VIEW ALL LIVE CAMERAS AND THIS WOULD BE A 5 star rating !

title: Last update frustrating
text: I've been a customer since the Kickstarting days and have always had a good experience. That is until the app update last week that had made using the cameras very frustrating in live mode.  You can no longer switch quickly between cameras, you have to wait for what feels like forever to avoid getting the "live view in progress" popup.

title: Unhappy  Customer 🤔👎🏼
text: Everything was fine until it showed that need to update in order to continue to see what my cameras are recording.  Well guess what! My camera will not accept the requested update; now I can’t use my blink system unless I purchase a new phone.  That is not in my budget to spend hundreds of dollar$ for new telephone.  How bout you buying me a new phone; ohhh you don’t like that idea??? Same here people. I will be an unsatisfied customer until you can fix the problem.

title: Too many issues.
text: Three stars because cameras physically are decent. However customer support is horrible, and always seems to be problem with system. “System too far from wifi” “sync module not responding” these are all the annoying features with this product. Don’t make a mistake and buy 2 units like I did. Look for better system

title: Standard
text: We have had the 4 outside cameras and 1 inside with no issues. As of late, the cameras seem delayed in recording for movement. Yet they say early detection. Not early…more like late. I’ve had to email them twice to try and re-sync 2 of the cameras. When these finally give up the ghost, I’m going with someone else. Paying $100 a year to see my videos is ridiculous.

title: Live view
text: Only one person can watch live view. That is the last person to connect their phone to their wi-fi when setting it up. Please fix so more than 1 person can see live view. Thx, fantastic product. Will be adding more cameras.

title: Average
text:
Easy to set up, works fine. A couple faults - notifications are slow to be sent. By the time I get the notification and open the app, the person is often gone or headed back to their car. 

Also - please add functionally to the app to allow multiple video clip deletes at once. Swiping one at a time is tedious at best.

Not the worst, but could be so much better.

title: Oops
text:
I purchased this system because it is wireless, easy to install and affordable. I haven’t had it that long and already I am having problems with it being offline. I tried to do what they suggested with no luck. It’s frustrating when your counting on a security camera to be working effectively and it does this already. 
I only gave 3 stars because of problems arriving so soon. Just disappointing.

title: Needs a snooze feature
text: I like the cameras and the app. I just wish there was a feature to pause the camera for a minute or two when I’m coming and going. Right now you have to turn off a camera or the whole system and I inevitably forget to turn it back on.

title: Careful if you don’t subscribe!!!!
text: I decided to go the route of non subscription, and boy do they really screw with your system. Load to view is very slow, you’ll get your belongings stolen before you can see what’s going on. This system is far from perfect and I hope they fix certain issues. Me, I’ll be shopping around for another security camera. One that doesn’t take nearly 30 seconds to load live feed.

title: Demands phone number or else locked out
text:
Forcing users to provide a cell phone number is absurd. It is not secure way to autheticate and gives out another piece of identifiable info.

On top of that, today they have locked me out of my account. The cameras stopped working. I tried logging back in and find I can't do that either.

I predict the developer response will be to contact them by email, just like the other complaints on hete. I already did that. Services are broken today.

title: Don’t y’all think y’all have enough complaints now
text: Seriously! Y’all need to get with it. Almost every review is a bad one. What’s the deal? get the app working correctly and fix the issues. The privacy statements are unbelievable. If someone buys a security camera they deserve to have privacy as well! Y’all need to get this app working correctly ASAP! Sad y’all don’t seem to care about the customers. If it weren’t for this stupid app the cameras alone would probably be a great product!! Fix the issues!

title: Live View no longer works
text: Bought system last summer and it worked great.  Over the last month, many of the best features have stopped working.  In particular, live view no longer works.  As others have speculated it is likely due to recent Apple updates and compatibility issues.   If considering purchasing this system I would wait until these issues are resolved.

title: Disable icon needs diff color scheme
text: The disable icon which looks like a man running needs to have either a bolder contrast or different colors for enable or disabled states.  The colors are very faint and at quick glance you can’t tell if it’s disabled or enabled.  Why put all this technology and money add more guessing work? Sometimes you just want to disable the camera so it does not eat up the batteries but sometimes you like to enable the camera to catch some bad guys going through your house.

title: Do not buy
text: I do not recommend this camera, nor the app. The camera itself is decent pixel quality, but everything else is lacking. Unfortunately the camera viewing time is 5 seconds, you have to keep pressing “continue watching” if you want to see more than 5 seconds of video. My main complaint, is that even with high quality WiFi, it is CONSTANTLY having connectivity issues. To the point that it doesn’t even fulfill its purpose.

title: Always requires update.
text:
It was my idea to get cameras for the house. We have specifically blink at our front door. 
It seems every other time I’ve tried to access the app recently it demands to be updated. 
This could be a real safety hazard. I do have to say that making the update isn’t all that time consuming, but it is an added extra step that makes me panic because I can’t see who is there right away.

title: A few things
text:
1st- battery life is no where near 2 years. I’ve had the cameras since early January 2021 & already have a low battery. 

2nd- I wish there was a way to set auto timers to disable/arm the system. I have dogs  who are in/out all the time & I know that’s why I have a low battery. I don’t always remember is disable it when I get home. It would be so nice to have it auto disable at the day/times I set. When I do remember to disable, I never remember to re-arm it.

3rd- quality is pretty dang good for the price of these cameras. I love that I can add cameras as I see fit. 

Overall a decent system, I don’t regret buying.

title: Do not update if you don’t want to give your phone number
text: The new version requires you to give them your phone number, but what if you don’t want to or have one? You’re screwed, the app won’t work without it, this is not a customer friendly direction, give us options.  I don’t care if someone hacks into my camera to see my chickens.

title: Disable scheduling toggle switch broken
text: Disable scheduling no working. It worked fine for a while. I would use it when I was out of town to keep my cameras armed 24/7 but for some reason every time I hit the toggle switch to disable scheduling it enables it on its own. It’s kinda frustrating. Can someone look into this and fix this feature!!

title: I Love it, It works, but..
text:
A great affordable system and I do not have anything to complain about really. It Works. The app is very lite and everything stays connected even during a power outage.  I do have a suggestion though.

It would be great if you could disable cameras individually with out deleting them, umm like “Camera Off/On”.

title: Unable to link 2 accounts
text: I have 2 separate systems that I monitor. My house and my mother’s house. My brother also monitors our mother’s house but doesn’t need notifications on my house. I’m having to sign in and out of each account to see what’s going on. This is very inconvenient. Hopefully Blink will come up with a solution soon.

title: Cannot sync
text: I am giving 3 stars only because of the assistance from your customer support. I was unable to sync, called customer support and still cannot sync. Blink is sending me a new sync module in case that’s the issue. Apparently there may also be an issue with the new apple operating system and the blink app causing this problem. Hopefully the new module will solve this issue.

title: Needs a bit of work
text:
It’s ok, but it needs the following:

Sync between devices. I have as of date, 93 un-viewed videos on my iPad, which have already been viewed on my iPhone. 

Time stamp on videos and also snapshots. This is huge. Yes I know that it shows the date and time on the app for captured videos, but this means nothing for legal issues. The name of the saved file can be EASILY manipulated.

title: Very good
text: I have been wanting blink a year now we finally got it works super good. We got 3 outdoor cameras we went to the beach and stayed for 3 days and I armed the cameras and it caught motion of my dog barking at someone in our woods🤨🤨🤨 and the two way audio worked really good. Again thanks for all you do Blink.

title: App Icon Counter broken
text: The counter display on top corner of the app icon does not work unless you actually have videos on file and then open the app and come back out of the app. This defeats the purpose as you won’t know you have them if you miss the initial pop up unless that counter indicator is working initially. Please fix this bug. It was working before one of the last updates you did for IPhone.

title: Option to FLIP 180! Please!
text: I love how easy it is to setup the Blink system. The options are great, too. There is one important option missing - to FLIP the cameras view 180 degrees. I know the camera can be rotated freely while on battery power, but I plug mine in via ISB power for longer recordings. You cannot mount the blink properly right side up while plugged in. The cord get in the way, even with a 90 degree USB cable. Please add the option to rotate the image 180 degrees!

title: Truly awful with USB-only local storage
text:
An awful camera system hooked up to an awful app. 

With a Cloud plan you can filter which cameras show up, but not with local storage?  That’s ridiculous. Plus the retrieval speed is horrific with local storage.  The cameras miss important video all the time because they are in some sort of battery-saving sleep mode more than they are activated.  People have walked right in the line of sight and the camera missed them.  I could go on and on.

title: What is next? A blood sample?
text: I purchased 3 of these cameras a few years ago. I own them. They are paid in full. To my surprise, I got a notice this week when trying to open my blink app that I must give them my email address And phone number to continue using my cameras that I purchased years ago. Data mining is getting out of control so I refused to give blink my personal information. Now I cant access any of my cameras. This has to be illegal. Forced Data Mining has to stop.

title: Camera
text: Very dissatisfied, I bought this to put in my girls room to keep an eye on them when they went to bed. When I click on the app you have to click on the video button to even see the room. It then shows the room for under a min then the app just closes. Now when I get on the app I can’t even get it to show the room before the app just stops and boots me out. It constantly just shuts off.

title: Could be better
text: Not a bad little camera, but the supplied mounting parts are of inferior quality. Most annoying, however, are the frequent REQUIRED updates that show up every 2 to 3 weeks—yes required, in that the app won’t even function until you run the s/w update! So if it just beeped to warn you of a possible intruder, TOO BAD; you can forget about actually viewing the video clip until you install the update.

title: Best security cameras
text: I’ve been using Blink for over a year and I’ve had great results, if you have even an ounce of common sense you can set these up to do exactly what they were meant to do. I’d say they are completely idiot proof but reading some of the reviews would prove me wrong.

title: App Recommendation
text: I would like to be able to manage the order of the cameras from within the app. If you want to rearrange the order, you are forced to delete the camera(s) and then re-add them in the order you want them to appear. Also, I have five of the same cameras however two of the five do not have the same options available such as adjusting the video quality. Weird.

title: Needs improvement
text: I find this app to be a little cumbersome. Particularly in the scheduling area. Additionally there’s no way to schedule individual cameras. They are all on or all off. We like to leave ours on all the time except for the one that is part of our living space. So we have to go in and manually turn it off every day twice a day. Please fix this.

title: No error in saving video when disk space is insufficient
text: If your phone is almost out of disk space, when trying to save videos from blink app, it won’t tell you that it’s not able to save the videos. You’ll be surprised that none of the videos are saved. You will delete all of them from app thinking that you save them successfully. This is a stupid bug, please fix it.

title: Notifications do NOT work
text: If the notifications don’t work, it’s basically useless. I’m on an iPhone and iPad. The delay is also annoying but they’re probably all that way. The images are pretty good though, in both light and dark. The app is pretty user friendly also. Someone else said being able to schedule individual cameras vs the whole system would also be helpful.

title: Feature requests
text:
Overall, I like the camera /app combo but I think a few small features would make it much better and save battery life.
- Add motion time frame mask in a similar way that cameras have view masks.
    o why? Because my camera looks at a space that sees a lot of wind effecting trees/plants/shadows by day but the wind goes away at night I.e. on Maui.
- add ability to just snap a single still image
   o why? Same as above really because the motion fires so often in wind it wore out the lithium batteries in 2 weeks not 2 years even with a ton of image masking. And it filled up the s3 bucket...
- maybe the dropped notifications I also see occur due to to many events?

title: Delayed
text: I bought the 5 cam set blink 2 not what I thought it would be. When it gives me a notification by the time the the cam is on it has delayed so long nothing is there or out of site. I have it mounted right above my garage and it won’t even pick up a car 20 feet in front of it .  I only bought these cause they are completely wireless.

title: Improvements
text: Love the camera , only thing I wish they would change in the app is the capability to set a ringtone when motion is detected. The ping noise is standard to all other apps and is very quiet. Hard to know it went off unless your on your phone or after it’s to late. A selection like messages or calls give you for a ringer would be nice.

title: Good but falls short in notifications
text:
Have a 2 camera system and everything works great, very pleased with views and motion detection and app.
However, not very usable on iOS, considering returning it because Notification sound is not customizable, so you can pretty much forget about hearing it while sleeping.
If blink can't fix this on iOS app they should sell a separate module that ring tones in house when alert is triggered

title: Connectivity issues
text: I love my cameras and would give it 5 stars but they have had some connectivity issues. I spent days with tech support before they finally sent me a new camera and I just recently replaced the batteries on one that was working great and now it won’t connect. I’m dealing with tech support on it and hopefully it will be resolved quickly.

title: Would not buy again
text: Night viewing is not as good as they want you to believe. There is a 10 second delay to start the recording too. So unless your intruder is skipping and hopping you are going to miss a vital part of the recordings.  They say batteries last 2 years. That may be true if you keep camera settings low and off during the day.  No, I would not buy this brand again.

title: Works pretty good
text: It works pretty good. Sometimes it takes to long to delete saved videos but that's not really a big deal. I am wondering if they are gonna make the app for Mac computers so we can also use our computers to monitor the cameras in the offices. Overall cameras work fine and the app works fine.

title: Actually works okay as a non real time system
text: What I hate about it is the fact that each time you update it it asks you to login again with your PW etc as if you’re a new user, then to add insult to injury it asks you to “verify the new device you logged in from” via email. Even though it is the same and only device/browser/IP address I’ve been using for 2 years! That’s pretty mediocre intelligence.

title: Love the cameras, but app always logging me out
text: I’ve been using the Blink outdoor cameras and app for over a month now. For the most part, I’ve been pleased. My biggest issues though are 1. The camera not turning on until after motion has ended and 2. The app is logging me out every few days. If you have any solutions, I would be most appreciative!

title: App needs a lot of improvement!
text: The app leaves a lot left to desire. The app is missing features you get in other apps that use $20 cameras like the Yi like motion detection that works, segmented motion detection options where you can pick a section of the screen to monitor, a smoother way to view saved video (which doesn’t even work), and quite a few more features and speed updates. What good are security cameras that don’t actually detect motion and record?

title: Great product
text: This is definitely a great video doorbell product which helps to store the video and keeps our home secure. Now I feel the home is more secured. It is easy to install with lot of features. Overall, I love blink home monitor app.

title: App Works Great!
text: I love being able to use my Blink app on my computer so I can quickly see cameras without having to use my phone. I have been a Blink customer for years now and have never run into any major issues

title: Cheap cameras, cheaply made app
text:
The camera:
The video quality is not so good, very pixelated. 
Night mode video is also not very good. 

The app:
you get basic controls but missing allot of very important features that are needed especially for viewing security camera clips: 
- scrubbing does not show you the video as you scrub making it hard to get to a specific frame
- pause / play controls are not intuitive- I would prefer to pause / unpause by tapping the video screen, not having the tap being up the controls and then you need to tap again to pause - it’s hard to pause on the exact frame that way. 
- various UI bugs
- would be great to arm / disarm based on entering / leaving a location

title: Mostly good so far but...
text: If my husband views or deletes a video clip, it deletes the notification and video from my phone also. We also cant view cameras on our phones at the same time. And my biggest thing is there isn’t an Apple Watch app for this! I hardly ever have my phone close by because I’m chasing kids around. I would LOVE to get the notifications on my watch so I could know to check my phone.

title: Almost perfect
text: The system functions nearly flawlessly.  I am very happy with the quality of the recordings on both indoor and outdoor cameras. It’s easy to set up and use. The only complaint I have is with the scheduling.  It does not have the ability to schedule multiple arm/disarm times, and I wish I could choose which cameras arm with the scheduling.

title: Setup is nice, viewing needs work
text:
I love the fact that I can screw these cameras to a tree.  But why can’t I save a snapshot to my camera roll from the app? Why can’t I pinch and zoom an image? Why can’t I rotate my phone and see the image in landscape mode? 

Come on guys, please add some basic viewing features.  You nailed the setup.  Now let’s get the daily usage working well.

title: Great system but.....
text: I wish there was an option that when I get a notification that there is movement on the camera, that when I click on it it goes directly to the camera feed instead of taking me to the homepage, then I have to go click on my videos. At least make it a option to where I can go straight to the camera feed for faster viewing.

title: Recent Update Issues
text: The app doesn’t allow you to listen via Bluetooth headphones.  Once the video is playing, all sounds come through the phone.  Also, if you are listening to music on Bluetooth headphones, as soon as you click to play a video clip within the app, music starts playing through the phone. This has caused some extremely embarrassing moments in the office.

title: Crash and burn
text: I have been using the blink system for almost a year now. I can honestly say I’m impressed with the quality of the system. Over the past few months though when I get notification and try to open the app crashes and I have to find the app and open through there.

title: “MARK AS SEEN/READ/VIEWED” … SOMETHING
text:
Really liking Blink. I use it outside and indoors..

But i have ONE MAJOR PROBLEM within the Blibk APP itself—

I’m one of those people who hates notifications… my spouse also always forgets to disarm the living room camera when getting home. So by the time I get off work I have 600 notifications of my spouse walking from room to room or the kids doing things kids do. It would be nice to have a “mark as seen” option… because I don’t want to necessarily delete the clips but just get rid of those pesky notifications.

P.S. currently have 10,341 of useless unseen clips  😑😑😑😑

title: App is terrible and makes the product useless!!
text: This was great for a while, until the app kicked out 3 other users. We bought this so the whole family could view the cameras from their phones, but apparently the app developers thought otherwise! It’s pointless to just have one person able to access it!! This needs to be resolved!! So disappointed!

title: Great but...   need a timer option...
text: Hey your app is great, but how about a timer option?   Where you can set it to arm the camera at specific time each night because someone in your house shuts it off and doesnt remember to turn it on??   There is you next big idea???!!!!   Pleas add this feature!!

title: Amazing
text:
I am not tech savvy 
So a product I can set up and run with amazing results and fast learning has to be 5 star
I actually would give it a 10 if it went that high. I Love this system
I’m in the Keys, Florida for 6 wks and I can monitor the care and safety of my horse facility back in Indiana.

title: Camera is fine, app is horrendous
text:
This might be the slowest, least dependable app I have ever used  in my 10 or so years using a smart phone. 

If you see someone walking on your property and your camera is not armed, by the time you can get the app pulled up to start recording, that person will have broken in, tied you and your family up, cleaned out your valuables, made a cup of coffee, and left. If you are actually concerned about home security, shop elsewhere.

title: Ok but needs fixes
text:
Have a dozen cameras and used this product for years.

Two main problems:

1). I want different notifications/rules for each camera.  It’s insane this isn’t a thing.  Yes you can do it by controller but I only need one controller and the interface when I use multiple controllers is terrible.  

2) The early notification feature (admittedly beta) is bad.  When I get it I click it and get taken to live feed.  Hate it.  Don’t care.  Usually the person left by then.  No way to distinguish between normal motion detection.  It should be a different color and/or give you two options — live feed or see the video history.  

Other than that, it all works fine.

title: Playback feature worse than broken
text: The video clip player portion of this app is still beyond worthless, and the publisher refuses to address it. It’s virtually impossible to reliably pause a captured clip and/or “scrub” back and forth to relevant sections of a clip, which is a needed and crucial feature if you are trying to then zoom in and capture a screenshot. What’s the point of capturing video if you can’t properly review and use it.

title: Wish I could give zero stars
text: Can’t even open the app after the most recent update but before that there were still so many problems. Worst issues are cameras not working without notifying you, horrible resolution between cameras with the same stats, horrible battery life, and half the features don’t work or only work sporadically. This is the first review I’ve ever left in the App Store because Blink is just that bad. Avoid this app at all costs.

title: Crider
text: I love mine. My biggest fault with them is they yse batteries up pretty fast. My dog sets mine off most of the time several times a day and night, which is probably why the batteries use up fast. It does help me keep up with him since he is an outside dog.

title: Only good if you subscribe
text: The app works good but if you don’t subscribe and use the local storage option they make it difficult for you to delete clips.  To delete clips you have to first swipe left then click delete one at a time.  The subscription version lets you select multiple clips and delete all at once.    I’m looking for a better alternative security system that doesn’t hinder you because you don’t subscribe.

title: Needs tweaks
text:
Good product for the money. 
The motion detection is so-so. It has issues depending on how the motion occurs. 
Newer models allow for more precise masking of areas not to include in motion detection which is very helpful. 
App needs a ‘snooze’ feature - on a windy day cameras can go off frequently, turning them off is only option but better would be snooze for x he’s/minutes.

title: Latest update stopped working with iphone5
text: I have an outdoor camera sink module tied to my iPhone 5. The latest update of Blink doesn't work with the latest version of iOS that is on my iPhone 5. I can't update my iPhone 5 to a later version than 10 point X because Apple doesn't allow it. So now I can't get into the app to delete my sink module because it keeps asking me to update the app but the app won't update because of the version of iOS so I'm screwed.

title: Blink
text: I’ve had a blink system for almost 2 years. It had worked great until about a week ago. I got a message saying that I need to upgrade the software but it will not download from the App Store. I’m waiting to hear back from blink. I will post an update at that time.

title: Great product!
text:
Easy set up, no wires and great video. I own 
7 and plan on getting more. The support for any questions is fantastic! The only thing I would change is being able to arm each camera as needed Instead of the whole system. I own both the XT1 & XT2

title: Buggy update -please fix immediately (former 4.5*)
text:
Former 4.5 star user review, system is non-functional -after update. 

Connectivity issues to existing system for outdoor cameras since recent update. 
Failed to disarm.
Failed to arm. 
Failed to live view. 
Failed to Live Photo. 
Failed to change settings, and preferences. 
—- 
There have been no changes to my network, and everything was working fine; great connection and speeds on all devices, on all bands, camera system saw very short delays for live view before this issues which is common, but it always worked. 

I’ve rebooted the network, tested connectivity on all other devices, including the Blink system. All other devices are connecting, and very responsive. 
Please help.

title: Do not bother
text: The cameras are just ok. Small and not bad looking but they do not have good resolution. That would all be fine but this app is awful. It hardly ever works which means I can rarely look at my cameras throughout the day. It is constantly saying there is some sort of error. I have to refresh the app several times to even have a chance at looking at the cameras. Wayyy better options available out there. Don’t bother with this.

title: App could use some work
text: I use cameras with local storage and the app fir that needs some work. It plays deleted videos unless you eject USB and you have to delete clips one at a time where with the subscription cloud storage you can delete groups or all at once.

title: Doog
text: Blink, what happened? After this latest update when I try to go live view camera to camera I get a message “live view in progress, please wait”. Sometimes this lasts only a few seconds other time it lasts seven or eight seconds, this is unacceptable please fix! App has been working beautifully till now.

title: Works well
text: I use 3  blinks in my backyard to monitor my gate, pets and 4 legged visitors. I has functioned well with hot sun, rain and one being mounted on  a door. The batteries last about 7 months but I can purchase replacements at  Costco. I do not use them in front because they snap into the mount and are easily removed or stolen.

title: Replace your router, and your investments in the system will be gone!
text: Works well first, but, once you replace your router you will not be able to use the system. You would go through the procedure to go beyond the solid green and blinking blue lights, but it will not “cynic” and you get stuck with solid red light.  Then, you try to reset, and reset, and reset .. forever, but you will go no where.  Something is deadly disturbing about this system or so.  The investment in this system is wasted.

title: Works great.
text: I bought a 5 camera package. Setup was a breeze. The video quality is excellent. Very pleased so far. My only critique is that they need to figure out how to make the notification sound customizable. It gets lost with all the other notifications. Otherwise. Great.

title: Live only for 30 seconds
text: I am very disappointed that the camera app Doesn't have a continuous live feature. I am using the camera as a baby monitor and i wouldn't have purchased the cameras had i known it was only live for 30 seconds. The sound is a little fuzzy and loud but the picture is incredible.

title: No 180° flip screen option!!!
text: It’s meh, definitely not a stand alone security camera system. But it could have its advantages being a small add on to an existing trust worthy system. Very fussy app, only one camera can do one thing at a time. Had to write this review when I found out there is no flip screen option if you mount your camera upside down… your image is upside down. Very simple update can make the user experience 1,000 X better.

title: Cannot connect
text:
Spent almost an hour on the phone with support. They’re solution it’s my WiFi. It’s not. My WiFi isn’t 5G, that’s cellular..... the camera isn’t sending out a signal. You can tell, it doesn’t show up in the WiFi list.  What an absolute waste.  They app can connect the device to WiFi, then the system is busy. Wait camera is showing. Nope now it’s gone.  

Funny how all my other devices are just fine, but it’s my WiFi...

title: Absolutely amazing!!
text: The app is great! The only suggestion is that it have a toggle in the settings for users to have the AUTOMATIC option to set ON a default arm set when the phone gets so far from the home base as to not forget to have alarm set. Thanks

title: Wish there was a way to control which camera I can “arm”
text: Really enjoying the ease and reliability of our BlinkXT2 cameras. I only wish there was a way to individually arm each BlinkXT2 camera instead of all or none option.

title: Solid,  but batteries could be better.
text: Doesn’t help when I have a lot traffic so close to house though. Cameras are going off left/right with the traffic. Trying to find a way to plug in my outdoor XT’s and still keep them water resistant the smart way. Any ideas?

title: works great
text: have had one little issue but we are in the works of getting it fixed .. to the people who want to complain about a cord and a little box taking up counter space well put it next to your router problem solved and it’s not on your counter . for the plug if that’s such a huge issue plug it into a wall outlet where it won’t cause a problem. . problems solved . easy set up my 11 year old can do it . next time ask for colored pencils and crayons to help you out if it’s that hard to do 😂 love the system even with the first little hiccup .

title: We love being able to live view our cameras
text: But since the latest update, whenever a camera is triggered the app automatically brings up the live view with sound in the background of my phone. All I hear is the audio and I have to go into the app to exit live view mode. Please fix this...

title: Notification Options
text: Need to implement the option to only get notifications for all systems or only a select few. I have two systems and would only like notifications to appear on my phone from only one of them.

title: Plug & Play
text: I have had the Blink system for two years. Original batteries worked entire time. Cameras have offered no trouble. I can look-in live anytime. I’m sorry to hear people have had problems. Not me. None.

title: Love the cameras but...
text: The only problem I am having is with the app. I don’t think it is phone related, but when I try to open things in the app it doesn’t seem to real me clicking on it. I don’t have any problems with my other apps, so I’m thinking it’s a Blink issue.

title: Weak software, don’t waste your $
text:
I’ve owned 5 cameras for about 2 1/2 years now. 
Cameras have individual setups to increase recording times….doesn’t work. 
Reaction time of each camera is so slow that a subject can walk by a station and never be seen but you will get a recording.
2 cameras ceased working, one they replaced the second one they won’t. So now I have just 4 stations. 
Going to buy a completely different system this month.

title: Updates
text: Newest update renders the app useless on my not so old iPhone. So really can’t use it when I am away from home. My iPad which is older than my phone still runs the older app. So if I want to use the app I will have to take iPad with me when I leave home. I don’t understand why my phone can’t run the old app. It’s just stuck on a prompt to update to a version it can’t handle.

title: App won’t even let you create an account
text:
Unboxed my blink cameras and went to my phone as instructed to download the app. 
App downloaded fine, but when I went to create an account, after entering my email address and selected password containing all the requirements, it says it can’t create an account fight now and to try again later. 
I tried again later as well as uninstall and reinstall app. Same results. 
Useless.

title: Decreasing motion detect sensitivity
text: I wrote a review a few weeks back indicating that motion detection on all six of my cameras has severely declined over time. I got an email suggesting I contact support and “update“ my review. I did the first - never heard back. Did not do the second, as I never hear back. Came back to my review today to update it to include the “no response from support”, only to find my review gone. I guess if you don’t update when asked, it gets deleted?

title: Notification settings need to be louder
text: There needs to be a way to change the notification settings to make them louder. One of the main reasons I bought this system was to catch people at night and the sound is not loud enough to wake me up. Please consider this for the next update.

title: Goes off line every other week
text: We’ve had nothing but problems with our 6 blinks, total waste of money! Every week we have to reset them and then the password doesn’t work again. I reset the password and then my husband is unable to use the app to view our cameras. He resets the password and then I can’t use the app. Neither of our passwords work for 2 cell phone applications. Gave up, I’m purchasing reliable cameras

title: Great little camera
text:
I’d give it a five star rating if it incorporated geo fence for turning on and off when leaving and coming home.  And a timer to have them come on automatically and turn off automatically at set times.  

Otherwise they are nearly perfect.

title: Fails to do what I ask it to.
text: I have my camera set to notify me when my house gets about 83° to remind me to turn my cooler on before I get home so that my house isn’t over 90° when I get home. This setting worked only a couple of times. Today, I looked at my camera and it tells me the temperature is 87° in my house but I never received a notification! Features like this shouldn’t even be offered if they never work. Disappointing.

title: Notification is poor
text:
The two biggest complaints, with an apple device you cannot change the notification sound and the one that come with it is very easy to miss.  Secondly, it doesn’t always notify me when it detects motion. I could easily miss a burglar breaking into the house. 
Otherwise, easy to set up and good clarity from the cameras. 
It won’t replace a burglar alarm though.

title: ❤️❤️ I’m in love with these cameras ❤️❤️
text: These Blink cameras are ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!! Easy set up.. sometimes the cameras didn’t pick up, but all you need to do is reposition them!! Night vision is awesome. Two way talk💪🏼💪🏼💪🏼👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼 I love my cameras!!! They are AWESOME!! I originally bought 2 then I ordered 3 more!!! I’m in love!!! When they go on sale again I will get more!!!Thanks BLINK YOUR CAMERAS ROCK!!!!!!!

title: Some issues
text: Great camera set up, very easy to use app. Only reason for 4 stars, if you are connected on two phones only one will get notifications and you can’t choose which one will. For some reason only my wife’s phone gets the notifications even if I’m the one to enable them on the app

title: Not iOS 12.4 compatible.
text: The app is great, however, after the latest iOS 12.4 update I cannot share or send captured videos via iMessage. It says sending failed. I’ve found that if I save the video to my phone first, then edit the length even if just to take a second off of it, then it goes through no problem. Something having to do with the phone re-saving the edited video? Please fix!

title: Great System
text: I’ve used 5 blink XT2 cameras at 3 different properties for about two years now. I find their range, durability, and battery life to be decent and the image quality is great too. Overall a great system and easy to use.

title: Live Length
text: Don’t want to have to keep hitting continue while watching live. If I’m trying to keep watch on something I want it to stay on. I can’t sit by it all that time to keep hitting continue every few seconds. This makes me mad and for that reason I need to get another brand. It’s a shame, a great camera ruined by a terrible app. There are other reasons this app is bad and I’m sure others are complaining but that one thing ruins it for me.

title: Updated App working again!
text: Update really was upsetting as it was requiring a two factor passcode via text or email, every time the app was re opened.  This delay really isn’t good for various security reasons and two factor really should be made as a toggled option vs a Blink Mandate!

title: Good camera
text:
I love the fact that it’s wireless and it uses AA battery. The battery life is great if u use Lithium battery. I wish it had an SD card for continuous recording tho.  The app could be better too.  
I hv two of this for my front door area and for the rest of the house I use Wyze. Wyze is great and cheep except that it’s not wireless.

title: It needs to improve
text:
I have 3 Foscam R2 cameras and decided to give a try to Blink XT.
The app is very poor and crashes a lot on iOS 12.1.
Not everyone like to use batteries, so it should be an option to open the app and see live video if connected to power. If I am opening the app is because I want to see my cams in action.
See other apps and adopt some ideas. The camera has potential.

title: 1st day great, second day different story
text: Cameras worked first day. Stopped picking up motion second day. Called tech support. Didn’t listen to the problem and didn’t know how to fix it. Was rude towards the end and just said cameras were working just fine. I’m disappointed because they were working perfectly and were exactly what I needed. Tech support confirmed my plan to return these cameras.

title: Needs a unique alert tone.
text: If something is happening at home, I want to know. Right now I get the same alert sound as Words with Friends, and my sports app. You get an extra star if you give me the ability to change the alert sound.

title: None are working since the last update!
text: System has been fine for the most part for the better of a year. All of a sudden, none of them are working. One is offline, and the others just spin with a ‘live view in progress’ error. No one else is attempting to view them so incorrect and we’re now unable to monitor our rental property

title: It’s great...but
text: The systems works as designed and fairly intuitive for set up and daily use. The only issues I’ve run into is it’s inability to keep the schedule I’ve  set up. Sometime it won’t turn off after the scheduled time, probably a couple times a week. Other than that I like the system.

title: Decent for money
text: I live on a busy street so the vibrations from trucks set these off. I have to turn sensitivity way down which then only triggers camera when subject is right on it. Would love to have a record button added so you can turn on live view and start recording manually.

title: Love the new update
text:
This is exactly what I have been wanting! The ability to filter by camera within a system and to view a clip on the same screen as the listing to delete/save right there. Keep up the great work!
Next: better motion detection!

title: Great for Live View
text: I have the blink indoor mini cam.  Sometimes it does come online automatically.  I have to do a live view to activate it.  I have it set to operate from 6 am to 6 pm.   My camera won’t  record at night, even though it is set for night vision. I love being able to perk out.  No more peeking out between the blinds.  👀The live view ROcKS!

title: Best cameras for the $$$
text: Love these cameras and the app. One request. Can you please add the ability for me to send an invite to someone else to create an account and have access to view just that properties cameras? I have a rental property and I want to give the renter access but not to the cameras at my house. Nest does this well.

title: Live view always has volume at full
text:
When you try to view a camera's live view, the app ignores the system volume (which is set at 0) and blasts at full volume. What's worse is it won't allow you to turn the volume down to 0 and always stays at at least 1. 

First of all, don't ignore the system volume. If I have my phone on silent, the live view should come on silent. Sometimes you're in a place where your phone is not allowed to make noise. Having the live view come in full volume is inexcusable.

Secondly, why on earth would you disallow the ability to turn the volume down to 0??

Since the bug is completely inexcusable and easy to fix, I have to give it 1 star until that is fixed.

title: Great Camera System And App
text: I’m using this app with the blink outdoor cameras and it works flawlessly. I’m not sure why there’s so many negative reviews for the app, but I’ve used other camera apps before and this one is by far the best.

title: DUMB! Phone number verification
text: This feature wasn’t thought through. Having to select a single phone number for an account, when an entire household may need to check the camera, makes this a terrible household option. I loved these cameras but have been forced to update to include this feature and now the camera is useless to ALL PEOPLE in my home except the person receiving the text verification.

title: Scheduling needs improvement
text: Overall not a terrible app. Easy to use. But my main issue is with the scheduling. It is easy to set up a schedule. But there is no way to schedule individual cameras or groups of cameras. It just turns on or off the last group/individual camera you had armed.

title: Sharing Access to View
text: It’d be nice to be able to have access control when sharing to view the camera with others. Instead of just signing in to other devices with full access.

title: Storage Issues After App Update
text: Once all videos are deleted app was showing 51%. I contacted support and they did few troubleshooting steps and told me to wait a few to days for it to resolve on its own. Three days later it showed 0%. That worked for about 4 days and now it shows 19% full with no videos. I agree with others that it worked better before.

title: Notification Sound Options
text: Camera’s work well, but the iOS apps kind of clunky, but the worst thing of all is that it doesn’t let you change the notification sound from the tone that’s used as the default tone for every notification. It’s been asked for since they came out, but a new UI that adds no additional functionality or ease of use was the only major update we’ve had.

title: Doesn’t Work Consistently
text: 1.  Lots of issues and error messages:  Live view failed, Thumbnail failed, system is busy!  One after another!  And this is constant!  2.  Instead of thumbnails, we should be able to view live video of all cameras at the same time. 3.  When you click on video to see a live view it takes forever to load!  What good is a security camera system with a buggy app?!

title: Works well
text: Camera works well app works well the only complaint I have for the app is that I have to keep clicking “continue?” Button every few seconds you should just make it continuous until the user clicks off the live view this would be much more convenient.

title: Ranch Owner
text:
I have both Ring and Blink, 
I would rate them comparable and easy for a Novice like me.  Picture Clarity, Sound Clarity, even when the picture is Enlarged
I bought a Wireless Security Cameras from Harbor Freight, but they failed to live up to what was claimed.  This is my honest assessment and hope it is helpful
